Reviews.Title: “A good hotel which needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: Sharlene A
Reviews.Content: Was here for two nights on a business visit. The hotel is in a good location and the servic was very good, but it is a bit old and in need of renovation. The room was comfortable but the furnishings need upgrading. There was no complimentary drinking water like in most hotels. Mini bar available, but there were no beverages in it. The furniture which had a Chinese design/theme looks dated and needs upgrading. The bathroom was very clean and there was complimentary shower gel, shampoo and toilet soap. Excellent water pressure in the shower. Clean bathtub. Bathroom was a bit small. Check in and out handled very professionally. Staff in the Sunrise restaurant were very polite except to guests who arrived at the closing time of the buffets, when they would almost rudely tell guests to hurry up or refuse to let them have the buffet. but overall the staff were courteous and helpful. There is no wifi in the rooms, but ou can pay $5 for 30 minutes usage in the restaurant. Old fashioned cable Internet facility is available in th room. In summary, it is a good hotel, bu needs renovation and modernization.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: robyn-aaron
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was a great location, walking distance to Bugis Markets, Chinatown, Mustafa Centre, a bit longer walk to Marina Bay Sands though. Consierge was fantastic, making sure we maxiumized our time. We are a family of 4, so this was perfect for us, Matty turned 13yo whilst there and was made a fuss of by staff. We included breakfasts, (staff were great here too) which made it easy too.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, Fair budget Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: cjohnny6
Reviews.Content: It is a budget hotel. Dont't expect too much. Location is good. Just within 5 mins walk to MRT. You can take 10Mins walk to Bugis and shop at Bugis Street. Rooms are in chinese style. Clean, washroom was in old fasion. Bed is just ok, can't say comfortable. We booked 2 rooms via SIA Stopover Holiday. It just cost HK$740 (US$95)per room. I can say its cheap as the hotels at Singapore are expensive. I have a baby and they can arrange a baby bed at free. It's ok if you looking for buget choice.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located hotels in singapore”
Reviews.Author: MohammedJaffar
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, good service, expensive with no free internet facility, food is average, could get good food outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katepthomas
Reviews.Content: My young daughter and I stayed for a week and had a great time. The hotel is very central, just down the road from Bugis Junction and Raffles city. It is also really close to the Bras Basah MRT station, which will take you wherever you need to go. We stayed in one of the unrefurbished rooms on the fifth floor, which was fine, though a little worn out. Was also great that they had laundry facilities so we could do our washing while we swam in the pool.

Reviews.Title: “A good SIA stopover choice”
Reviews.Author: DaisyClover
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights for $85 per night on a Singapore Airlines stopover package which was excellent value, given the outrageous cost of rooms in Singapore these days. I have stayed at the Grand Pacific many times before in it's emanation as the Allson and before that the Taipan Ramada, and am always comfortable here. There is still some of the indestructible rosewood furniture in the lobby. The room was not too small and the decor is modern, no nice old rosewood furniture left here. It has everything that you expect in a decent Singapore hotel: toiletries, robes, flat screen television, mini bar, coffee making. Breakfast is not included and why would you pay for a hotel breakfast when the food courts of Singapore are outside? I especially love the location of this place which is near Waterloo Street and the vegetarian restaurants at the Fortune Centre.

Reviews.Title: “You dont always get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Chris L
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid, we could have definitely found a better hotel. The room they gave us for 2 people only had 1 bed, and I was surprised by how small the room was for the price (room service could barely fit through the door). We were greeted by a half welcoming staff, meaning some welcomed us with a nice and warm greet, and some gave us the cold shoulder. I was lucky to receive any acknowledgement from any of the concierge from then on. The Location is great as long as you take a taxi to most places, Chinatown is about a 10 minute taxi ride. They give you a 50% discount on breakfast for in hotel guests, and even after the discount it is still a bit pricey. It is a mediocre breakfast buffet at best. The hotel itself was very clean and well kept. The maids did a great job with the rooms, and stocked the bathroom with plenty of toiletries everyday. Although it was my first visit to Singapore, I would not revisit this hotel. I' am definitely going to stay at other hotels and compare them to this one and see if this is just a standard hotel there.

Reviews.Title: “A decent enough hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: cromerty
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four with 7 and 11 year old sons. We had stayed at the Grand Pacific when it was the Allison Hotel many years ago and it was little changed. Plus points: -Very helpful and polite staff, even during busy periods -Location -quie central and easy to walk to Clark Key and other attractions- about 20 mins -Convenient Hawker center opposite the hotel -Generally clean and well kept within the constraints of it being quite an old hotel. -Beds big enough to hold a family of 4 in the 2 queen size beds in the room -wash and dry facilities Minus points -Rooms and bathrooms were quite small and dark -Breakfast was very average -Pool area rather shabby and worn -no little extras apart from two small bottles of water- All in all, a good stopover hotel for a few days and very acceptable if you are looking for a good basic 4 star hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Happy People with some niggles”
Reviews.Author: Pegasus65
Reviews.Content: Hi, We have visited the Grand Pacific Hotel many, many times over the last eight years, sometimes with friends, sometimes four times per year and have always been happy with our stays. The staff are great, I even get welcomed with a kiss and a hug from all the Concierges who are great people. The rooms are standard rooms that we book although you can book premier rooms for 25 UKP a night more, this room comes with breakfast usually. The standard rooms are rosewood and are a comfortable size and have all the usual things in the room. The hotel has a pool and one thing which I think hotels should have is a self service laundry ($6.00 plus $6.00 SP). The Grand Pacific has this and that is super handy to have. The only drawback we have since we have been visiting the Grand Pacific Hotel, the rooms have gone up from 53 UKP to 110 UKP per night since 2009. This price would include breakfast for two people. I would like to ask the question why? I expect price rises but not that much. They are pricing themselves out of existance where many people cannot afford to pay these prices, expecially people like ourselves who go for a week or so at a time. They don't do a long stay rate which is extremely unusual nor Corporate rates. We have been told for the last three years that the rooms are being upgraded, the standard room that we were in hadn't been. We used to get high floors but now they won't put us any higher than floor 9. However, the premier rooms are the higher rooms. We have also noticed that the hotel is never full, only 50% full, so why don't they lower their prices and include breakfast and it would be brilliant. I would like to tell you about the breakfast which we have had in the past alot. The staff remember you if you come back, you have all the usual buffet food including a counter where you can ask for eggs and bacon, omelettes all freshly cooked. The lady that works on that section is great, doesn't speak alot of english but you ask for what you want and she does it for you perfectly. Hassan (very nice gentleman with a suit on, you cannot miss him) is extremely obliging and will help in any way he can. He originally said "come and stay at this hotel, you will not be disappointed". We haven't been. One tip, ask for a room facing Victoria Street, if you face the back where the pool is there is alot of noise in the room and it is bad. Book your hotel on an asian based website, don't assume you have to book if with your tour operator. I have been booking holidays for ourselves (2 people) and our friends (4 extra people) for ten or so years and have never had a problem that we could not fix. They also have a fantastically easy transport system near the Grand Pacific, you can go on three lines on the MRT, work out where you are going on a map then go to the one that works for you. The buses are great, we have been out in the middle of nowhere not knowing where we will end up and have seen buses that say on the side of them Victoria Street and we have hopped on. Easy. The other thing I would say is get an EZY card with stored value which we keep using everytime we go. The value stays on it and lasts for as long as you need it within reason. Don't be the person that has to buy the ticket, if you do don't forget you get a dollar back after you have completed your journey. It is obviously daft if you are only there for one or two days, but it is still nice to take home for a souvenir. We have had ours for years and have had a changeover card due to the original one being upgraded. When you go for your stay always go in a taxi from the airport, everywhere in the world is expensive, not there! We have never paid more that $20.00 (10 UKP) each way, but we have always arrived in the daytime. The price can double between midnight and 6am. Do not book the shuttle you want to get there quicker unless it comes as a freebee. An American company has recently taken over the Grand Pacific Hotel and thinks oh we will put the prices up by 100%, nobody will mind, tourists will pay it. It is sad and I really would like to get a reply from Head office on this matter. I would also want some sort of loyalty scheme for regular customers that they get points etc like the Hilton, or an automatic upgrade as many hotels do in Asia and Australia. We have already stayed one week on this holiday and are going back in 10 days for 8 nights and will ask for a different room again. I have a list of which are ok and which are not. We are looking forward to it. About Singapore review: Why do people only come to Singapore for a stopover? I have talked to many people and they say "yes, I've been to Singapore", and I say "great, where did you see?" The usual places are Raffles, Sentosa Island, Bird Zoo, Night Zoo etc. What are these people doing, they are missing the great places as well that are undiscovered. We have been on many really good walks and seen loads of wildlife that are wandering about. Last week we went to Kranji and got on a bus $3.00 SP each and went to the Wetlands Centre, we saw snakes, monitor lizards (big Ones), birds and all sorts of other creatures. It was brilliant and in the middle of nowhere. We also walked up to the Henderson Waves bridge and carried on for miles over the Southern Ridges on a tree top walk. At the end we caught a bus to the MRT and got that back to the hotel. You can go skiing at the ski place, go to museums, go for exciting things like Universal worlds and Sentosa Island. My tip go on the luge and go as fast as you can and buy a five go ticket for $25.00 SP, it is extremely good fun. Go on long walks, there is something for everyone including nature lovers. So we love Singapore and have been lots of times and are still finding loads of things to do, we are usually the only english people doing them but hey what does it matter! It is extremely safe, I have never been to a place where I felt like that all over the island. So my tip is take longer, stay longer plan what you want to do before you arrive. Talk to the Tourist Board, they have helped me time and time again. Thanks for reading my review, Pegasus65.

Reviews.Title: “You can do so much better in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Terserus
Reviews.Content: This is an average middle class hotel. nothing special to complain at, nothing special to remember. Location is great though.

Reviews.Title: “Cold”
Reviews.Author: uprightM
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff treatment to the guests is just as cold as the air temperature that blows from the central aircon in the rooms. Staff are not rude, but equally not helpfull. Do not be fooled, however, by the temperature selector in the room: it doesn't matter what you set, it will always be freezing cold inside and you will need a good blanket to sleep in full tropical summer. Breakfast is another trap: extremely overpriced and not included in the room rate (and worst - they do not tell you it when checking in). For less the half price, you can have a full meal just crossing the street. Decor is also outdated, but everything was working well. At least there was a nice bathtube where you can warm up a little to face the cold air in the room. All in all, it is a poor and overcharged place in a good location and, regarding we stayed there on behalf of Singapore Airlines, we can certainly say thet this place is obviously below the Singapore Airlines standard.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at best.”
Reviews.Author: Mai L
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel for under a week and the hotel amenities were ok but not great. One of the things that really annoyed me was the use of the internet in which you had to put a down payment of $10 on a LAN line cable to connect to a port hole with unreliable service, spending at least an hour just to connect! Not only that, the rooms would always be too cold once we got back even though the key wasn't plugged into the power system. Most of the staff were nice and friendly and offered great eatery suggestions if you asked.

Reviews.Title: “An okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: krizia_lazaro
Reviews.Content: It was an okay hotel. Nothing fancy. The rooms were a bit old and small. The outlets were hidden from view. They do have good service and a very delicious breakfast buffet. I would probably come back because its cheap and has a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, comfortable rooms just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: kylznmuz
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel with comfortable rooms and great service. Our doorman Velu booked us some great packages and all the staff did their jobs well.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel, nothing fancy”
Reviews.Author: Gabriella19147
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 10 nights. It was a solid hotel; clean and functional but nothing fancy. Don't be fooled by their advertisement of a "gym"--it's merely nothing more than two treadmills and two stationary bikes. And don't forget to plug in the treadmills when you want to use them. The outside garden/pool area is lovely but since it was rather rainy we didn't get to use the pool. The breakfasts are included and it's a pretty expansive all-you-can-eat buffet. There are two 7-11s near the hotel so that you can grab some water and maybe other things to keep in your mini-fridge. The hotel is located close to Raffles City and the Raffles Hotel, and in easy walking distance of the marina and even Arab Street (so called in local parlance.) The hotel staff is quite accommodating and helpful. All in all this was a solid 3-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: jakefinland
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location -- you are able to reach everything in the center of the city by walking (for Marina Bay I would take a bus or a taxi). Big and clean rooms with standard amenities and comfortable beds. Gym is quite small. For a business trip I'd stay again but for a longer holiday I would probably choose something else like Marina Bay Sands.

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel - Better places to stay”
Reviews.Author: AussieTrvler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights. I would rate this as a 2-3 star hotel. The rooms are in desperate need of renovation. The bathrooms are very small and the shower is located in the bathtub. Our toilet clogged many times during our stay which was frustrating. The breakfast is pretty average and overall the service was average also. For the prices advertised to stay here it is definitely not worth it. and I would not recommend travelers to stay here. You can easily here other people in adjacent rooms at night and we also found it very annoying the room service would come into our room whilst we were in there to clean, why they could not wait for us to leave after having breakfast is beyond me. The rooms are simply not up to standard considering the cost. I would certainly not even recommend this hotel to budget travelers. There are better places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore Stopover”
Reviews.Author: bwb_pioneer
Reviews.Content: Made a day stopover in Singapore and stayed at the hotel grand pacific it, is a basic 3 star hotel nothing really special about it, there are a couple of things you need to watch out for. 1) If you arrive in the morning you will be charged for breakfast which is really Expensive for what you get.(easier to pop across the road to get something from the mall or go the one of the eateries close by. 2) DO NOT listen to the advice of the hotel staff concerning where to shop, I followed the advice of some of the staff who gave me a free cab to what I thought was the Sim Lam Square and the cab took me in the complete opposite direction to some tiny shop and tried to sell me an over price camera lens (lucky for me this isn't my first rodeo, just make sure you take a map everywhere is pretty walkable). In summary this hotel is ok for a SHORT stopover but not for an extended stay

Reviews.Title: “Basic 3 star hotel, inflexible service”
Reviews.Author: Ler0yb
Reviews.Content: Location: Great location just off the bottom of Orchard rd, close to main shopping areas, MRT and a stroll to Little India, Bugis, Raffles City etc. Rooms: A little tired but do the job. Rooms included standard amenities and were comfortable. The pool is OK and nice to have a dip after pounding those Orchard Rd pavements. Service: Our wholesaler had requested a few extra services for us, and not one of them was even mentioned. When a slightly later check-out was brought up with staff - they didn't want to know and would not even check, making excuses they were full and then offering for us to purchase the late check out for another half day! Overall: Great location, OK rooms, but service lets them down.

Reviews.Title: “appalling service”
Reviews.Author: chrisMiddlengland
Reviews.Content: I arrived late in the morning. I was refused breakfast because I wasn't allowed to have breakfast on the morning of arrival - only on the morning after I'd stayed. Note: the breakfast had been paid for by the company. After getting to the room Internet wasn't wireless, so I went all the way down again to get an ethernet cable. It was so short I had to sit sideways against the wall for it to reach. The room was freezing cold. When I complained, I was told to put something in front of the door to exclude the drafts from the airconditioning in the hall. I ended up sleeping in my sleeping bag.

Reviews.Title: “Bit long in the tooth put no complaints”
Reviews.Author: JoCoMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks like it has been around a long time but is basically a reasonable place to stay. The rooms are a good size, comfortable and clean. The first night there we had a twin room with separate beds and asked for a double which was available the next night. The twin room was noisy - from other rooms. The double was extremely quiet. The staff were helpful enough and it is in a good location near Raffles and close to the metro. Probably about a 20 min. walk to the main shopping area in Orchid Road. A real winner was that after an early arrival in Singapore the hotel enabled you to check in at approx. 10.00am and check out at 1.00pm. A real bonus when you have had no sleep on plane. Part of the Singapore Airlines stopover deal which is also an advantage.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Pacific Hotel, Singapore”
Reviews.Author: MegaDancer
Reviews.Content: I went to Singapore for the first time on the 11th Oct 2011. I spent 7 days at the Grand Pacific Hotel. The hotel was clean and comfortable and breakfast included in my rate. The breakfast was a buffet style affair and was very good. The room was clean and the bed had a very firm mattress that was very comfy. The bathroom had a shower and tub - although the tub was rather short in length. The pool was lovely and there was an abreviated poolside menu. There was a basic gym facility which I did not use. Overall I enjoyed my stay in the hotel - not luxury, but very good holiday accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “TOP PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: Sandra B
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Singapore 26-30 Sept 2011. Travelling alone, 50 year old woman. I found the Grand Pacific Hotel a top class establishment. I was on the tail end of a 8 week European tour so could compare to many top Hotels worldwide. My room was beautiful, plenty of space, extremely comfy beds and looked out on the Singapore Flyer. 10-15min walk and you are at Marina Bay and heaps to do from there. 5 mins and some great shopping malls, Raffles, Brugis St Markets. It was brilliant and I never felt unsafe even out late at night. The Staff were absolutely amazing, could not fault them. Just a note to be aware of I looked at the breakfast menu $30 for full everything you could eat, however if you are a guest it is only $15 so not as expensive as you may first believe. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Long stay at Grand Pacific”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_mj12
Reviews.Content: Due to my work in Singapore I was doomed to stay in Grand Pacific more than 15 weeks. However my overall view on the hotel is still very positive. The hotel staff was always very friendly and helpful and whatever problems I had in my room they were able to fix them within next few hours. The Laundry service was excellent and always on time. The swimming pool was much better located comparing to the next door Hotel at Queens and most of the day you were able to enjoy sun in a clean and enjoyable pool area. The location of hotel was excellent: a MRT station (Bras Basah) just round the corner and Chijmes with dozen restaurants and the Raffles mall just few hundreds meters away. The breakfast was the weakest point of my stay: unfortunately it was always the same and very poring. However there were always a cook available to make fresh omelette and prepare eggs as you want.

Reviews.Title: “was ok”
Reviews.Author: Ken V
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival they were friendly and nice to my 7 year old son, but that changed the day after where staff was not friendly as much anymore. When asking if I could take an earlier ride to the airport they acted like i was asking for something impossible and I had to keep asking before they actually rung the van driver. Expensive breakfast so I wouldnt suggest having it there. Rooms were small but sufficient. Overall ok but I wouldnt be going there again...

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: westcountryyokel
Reviews.Content: This hotel could not be better placed for location for our needs - as first timers to Singapore we found it fab! Rooms were the standard 'you could be anywhere' in the world style room but clean and comfortable - we could see the Singapoe Flyer from our room! Small pool and laundry on level 5 as is the small gym. Staff very friendly and breakfast is international style with something for everyone - we miss the smiley, friendly face of the omelette lady!! The only downside is that they do not have a bar as such - if you want a drink you sit in reception ( or do as we did - for a cheap Tiger beer - hope over to the hawker centre across the road - open until late) Location is our main priority in a city break and this ticked the box!

Reviews.Title: “Needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: colin0235
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well positioned near Raffles Centre and the MRT. I have been staying here over the last 15 years and the rooms really need renovating.You need to get it at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room and Good Service”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyChai
Reviews.Content: i stay 1 day 2 night at this hotel. my comment is, The staffs is very helpful and friendly. Room is clean and food also delicious. Location of the hotel is pretty good. there are few shopping center, cafe and bar around and also close to train station, Bugis Village and Museum.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: ast2000
Reviews.Content: The room was very small. Even we want queen bed they gave a twin bed room and they said that this is the last room that they have. The beds are not so clean and so the room. The lobby also very small and the staffs try to emphasize some tours or electronic shops to you.The quality of the breakfast is also not good.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific in almost every way”
Reviews.Author: Lewis_and_Clark
Reviews.Content: I have been to Singapore a number of times. This was a business trip and I stayed at the Grand Pacific (formerly the Allson) for 11 days. The hotel met all of my expectations. The check in was without problems even though I arrived at 1 in the morning. The room was ready and nicely set up. They are not overly spacious, but there was room for a (very comfortable) queen sized bed, a refrigerator with tea/coffee service on it, a desk with internet capabiities, and an easy chair with ottoman. The bathroom was not overly large but perfectly functional. The room was efficiently cleaned each day and the staff were pleasant. Sheets were changed every other day, or every day if requested. Some commented in other reviews about a musty smell in the rooms. That was definitely there if you didn't turn the air conditioning on. The a/c was highly effective. People must understand that Singapore is a VERY humid country -- the humidity each day approached 100 per cent and it wasn't raining. So I am sure that most everything has a bit of "wet" or "musty" smell. It's just a hot and wet country and you have to get used to it! The breakfast buffet was pleasant -- and yes, often the offerings were the same. But most of us eat the same thing for breakfast anyway. There was always cereals with milk, an omelette/egg station, breads and pastries, lots of fresh fruit, salads, and on the warm side, there was usually a Singaporean noodle dish, baked beans, grilled tomatoes, sausages/bacon, and potatoes of some sort. There was a sign on the buffet noting that people who left food on their plates would be charged 3 dollars for every 100g -- at first I was offput by that. And then I thought about it and realized it was just a way of reminding people not to waste food -- and they're right. I didn't ever see anyone charged. And I remembered to take only what I could eat, and if I was still hungry, I went back for seconds. There is a lovely pool on the 5th floor and I used it when I was doing my laundry -- there's 2 or 3 washers and dryers near the pool and it was fun to go swimming while waiting for my laundry to be done. By having the launderette, I was able to bring half the clothes I needed. That's a great perk. I managed to fit all my stuff in one suitcase which I did not need to check. There's also a fitness center near the pool -- it has two or three treadmills and some bicycles. There are also some free weights. Nothing very fancy, but good enough for me. Overall, I thought it was a wonderful place -- close to everything and a solid 3 star service.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean hotel, awsome location, not so friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: AtriumExplorer
Reviews.Content: We, a group of 5, 4 adults and 1 kid stayed in the hotel for 5 days. It is definitely not a high end 4 start property, but rooms are clean and tidy and spacious enough. Did not have such a very bad experience, however, there should be a lot a of improvement from staff with respect to hospitality. I have hardly seen Singaporeans smiling, so the same applies here too. Swimming pool was nice, mostly deserted, but closes at 9 pm. Hotel Breakfast is good, not breathtaking, anyways- but will give you enough calories for a day. Right opposite to the Hotel, there was a 24 hours open Hawker food, which helps you taste all local food. My suggestion is do not take any Fish if you are not Chinese and if you are Indian. Average meal cost is SD 5.00, which is indeed cheap - try different varieties of Chicken Rice, if you are non veg! Dont even think about going there if you are Veg- they use same spoons for non veg and veg. My family except myself, all were veg and had to go to little india, pretty much walkable within 15 minutes. Avg meal cost in Indian veg restaurants is around SD 8.00. Its good to try singapore hawker food, as it is clean and upto the standards. And if at all you have ever been into a Zoo, do not opt for Night Safari, as I felt it was definitely bad - u cannot even see animals properly though it has a huge built up and the lighting is so so bad, that you cannot really see anyone! Plus the animals are the Indian cows, Bison, Indian elephants, Rhinoceros and a glimpse of lion and tiger, thats it, not really worth the pain of getting there as you would need to be in queue and be really patient.

Reviews.Title: “Not much value”
Reviews.Author: Z9657
Reviews.Content: The room costs me SGD230+++ per nite and I don't see much value staying there. Located in Singapore's CBD, you won't be able to find restaurants around you unless you walk a few blocks away. Breakfast in the hotel is ok. When I checked in, an old man is at the reception and gave me a room with someone still in it! I don't blame him though coz it's late at night when I checked in but really, this kind of mistake should never be repeated.

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: kiwideni
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July 2011 as part of the SIA Stopover Programme. Our room was really outdated, old furniture, old bedding, old bathroom, old tv etc. Our room was on a low floor and our windows were behind some kind of design on the outside of the hotel meaning you had to have ALL the lights on in the middle of the day otherwise it would be extremely dark.. The bathroom was ok but the inside of the bathtub was starting to get scummy..I think the SIA package is just for a standard room but you might be able to pay for an upgrade and get a better room- judging by other travelers photos and comments, I wish we had! The location of the hotel is pretty good though, about 10 minutes walk to Orchard Road, close to Raffles Hotel and several Malls. There is a 7/11 right next door if you want to grab water and snacks. The Sentosa Rider is also about 5 minutes walk away which was handy. Our package did not include breakfast and if I were you I'd skip it and go somewhere else. Inhouse guests are offered 50% off the breakfast menu and thank God because if you eat from the both sides of the buffet, it's $30 per person! If you only eat from one side, say the fruits and pastries etc, it's cheaper, but they don't tell you that! I'd probably go somewhere else next time...

Reviews.Title: “Short walk to a lot of sightseeing spots”
Reviews.Author: woodenshoe_8
Reviews.Content: Once again we were in Singapore and the Grand Pacific Hotel, this time booked via Singapore Airlines Stop Over Arrangment. We were familiar with this hotel however now it turned out we got a renewed room. Our stay was just for 1 night but after our trip to Australia we came back for a longer stay in the same hotel and asked for the same room. The renewed rooms have a higher price but anyhow we could get an other room (also renewed) on the same floor without paying an additional amount. Not all the rooms are already renewed, just several floors. As several guests already mentioned the location is good. You now can also go (walking distance) to Marina Bay Sands with the casino, the big underground shopping centre (several levels) and the new museum instead of going to Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but convenient location”
Reviews.Author: biniland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights. I think we had a premier room but still it's quite small. the air-con made a lot of noise. There is not much natural sunlight through the window. The breakfast was okay but not fantastic. Definitely not a four-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BillParis
Reviews.Content: I agree heartily with all the comments made by other positive reviewers. We stayed here for five nights on a SIA stopover. We had stayed here eight years earlier and liked the place and were not to be disappointed a second time. Probably the hotel's greatest advantage is its location. You could not want to be any more central. Shopping in Orchard Road is a 15 min walk away, the harbour a 10 min walk and the nearest station only a short stroll. As has been stated, the rooms are a little dated. We had expected that following the name change, the hotel might have up-graded its rooms. They hadn't (or at least the rooms on the floor we stayed in). Still, for just over 100€, we were not complaining! Everything in the room worked well, the beds were comfortable and all was very clean. The room standard reminded me of a Mercure Hotel: not top-luxury but excellent value. The hotel pool was the ideal place at the end of a hot day, not too busy and well maintained. We found the staff helpful and were delighted to be able to get into our bedroom when we arrived early at 7.30am. The only disappointment was the breakfast. Expensive and rather limited. No cereal or milk products were on offer and the croissants less than appealing. Still, Raffles City was just around the corner! Internet access can be found at the centre just opposite the hotel at $2, rather than paying the $20 per hour at the hotel. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel. It's excellent value in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Good Location, Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: MichelleM50
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. The staff at the concierge are extremely helpful and friendly. Especially Velu, he organised transport for us and gave advice on places to visit and places to eat at. The hotel has a nice pool, and we had it to ourselves since it was quieter in June. The room was spacious, the bed was quite big and firm. Within close walking distance there is the Raffles Centre and Bugis Street. we stayed at this hotel with a three year old child and i would definitely recommend this hotel for families.

Reviews.Title: “Welcomed with a warm smile”
Reviews.Author: Inverugie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for five nights. We stayed in the Premier Room which was very nice but a little small for an upgraded room. The room was clean and even if slightly small it suited our purpose. The service at the front desk was excellent and the staff tried to help and assist us as much as they were able too. The breakfast was well presented and they had a special chef to cook our eggs in a special way. The hotel is central to the Raffles Hotel and a lot of other interesting places to go and visit. The pool had lots of greenery around it and in the pool area they had two washing machines and a dryer.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SandyPants79
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location. Its in walking distance to the MRT, markets, Raffles hotel and Raffles Plaza (which has a great supermarket, chemist, eating, shopping etc). A 7eleven is right next door. Internet cafe is right across the road in the Bras Bazaar The other thing we really liked was that the hotel has coin operated wasing machines and dryers, very convenient. The machines are on the pool deck area (a bit weird) but you can chill out by the pool while waiting for your clothes. The staff were very nice to us, and let us check very early, 7.30am The negatives, the breakfast was very poor quality. We didnt eat there some mornings, preferring to go to McDonald's for breakfast (which is also in walking distance) Our room was very stuffy with terrible air circulation (none), the air conditioner didn't work well. There was no exhaust fan in the bathroom, so it ended up pretty foggy and humid into the bedroom. And, we had noisy neighbours, so obviously the rooms aren't real sound proof. Plus the view out of the window was roofs and exhaust fans. All of this being said, we did rent the cheapest room so I'd say if you spend a little more you may get a better room.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good!!”
Reviews.Author: SoniaG4
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night on a SIA Stopover. Small, dark & dingy room which smelt and felt very damp - triggered my son's asthma!! I paid for 2 nights as we were arriving at 7 am after a long overnight flight. When we arrived we were told the room would not be ready until after 8 am!! Not very happy I had to argue with staff to get a room as, technically, I'd paid for the room to be ready from 2 pm the day before!! I suppose that was Singapore Stopovers fault? Never ate in the hotel so can't comment on the food. We were out sight-seeing till late, then up early the following morning for our flight. The hotel's location was good - within walking distance of many of Singapore's sights.

Reviews.Title: “Only three star, but clean and comfortable, terrific location”
Reviews.Author: sydcar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a three day stopover. The hotel itself is an older style, with our room looking older, darker and in a chinese style, but having said that the bathroom and room was clean and comfortable (if a little overpriced). The location of the hotel is it's main selling point. Bus stops are directly across the road and about 20 metres down from the front door, from here we found that we could get to just about anywhere in Singapore. There are plenty of resturants and shopping malls close by, and within walking distance to the Raffles complex and Orchard Road. The staff I found were a bit standoffish, but efficient. Breakfast in the dining room was lovely, with ample asian and western style foods and plenty of it. There is a nice swimming pool on the fourth floor which we didn't know about until the second last day there as the booklet about the hotel was hidden away in the back of one of the drawers. Would I stay here again, yes, I think I would!

Reviews.Title: “not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: leacas
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 6 nights as was disappointed as we were advised that this is a 4 star hotel and it clearly wasn't. The rooms have been rennovated but to a poor qulity and they were dark. The swimming pool was very small and not a place where you would lounge arounge. The staff spoke a minium of English. The buffet breakfast was average. The only positive thing about it was the location. Victoria St is a great stop to be in as it is in the centre of all the major attractions. If I go back to Singers I will be trying a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location good”
Reviews.Author: Travellotz66
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after a 4 week African Safari as a stopover for 4 days. Arrived very early in the morning and our rooms were ready shortly after arrival, which was great. Room was fine, tidy and clean, slightly dated. One thing annoying was the pool closeure time at 9pm. Far too early. Breaksfast not good as Continental did not include cereal, only fresth fruit, toast tea and coffee. This is the first hotel around the world where continental does not include cereal.For the full price of $20 per head this was not good value at all. Found the lady overseeing the breakfast very intimidatiing and made you feel guilty as she kept watching people like a hawke to see what you were eating. Staff very nice Laundry good. Overall, a nice hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: DJM56
Reviews.Content: This hotel is advertised as 4 star but does not live up to its star rating. The rooms advertised on their website do not live up to the rooms you are given. The rooms shown on the website are apparently their executive suites. We were given a deluxe room which isnt even shown on the hotels website. We were then moved to another room which had bed bugs. I dont know what the procedure is with dealing with bed bugs, as this was a first for us, but I do not think the hotel dealt sufficiently with our personal effects to be sure they were not infected. We felt the rooms were dirty, especially at the base of the walls and edge of carpet, the bathrooms are very tiny. The pool closes at 9p.m. which was a real pain as when you are hot and tired after a hot day/night in Singapore it would have been lovely to have had a swim to cool down. We really did not enjoy our stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good as a 4*”
Reviews.Author: JanakS
Reviews.Content: Formerly called Allson. Allson was 2* post renovation they are a good 4* hotel. Efficient.

Reviews.Title: “There are plenty of rooms for improvement”
Reviews.Author: leenadevi
Reviews.Content: This is just an OK hotel. The OK part: - Hot shower, clean spacious room (for 2), late checkout (1pm), a short walking distance away from MRT (CC line), helpful reception personnels. The NOT OK part: - The number one thing that disappointed me : There was no free internet/WIFI. You will have to pay SGD10 per day for Internet access via cable. Cable rent/deposit is SGD10. - Breakfast is the same selection every single day. - There is a noticeable difference the way Asian/Local guests being treated. The hotel staff seem to be more friendly to non-Asian tourist (serving coffee or drinks, frequent greetings, etc) - The pillow gave stiff neck - Complimentary drinking water only on the day of arrival. - Tried the buffet lunch and it was only OK. Not much variety but the taste was good enough. - Very small bathroom. The bath tub is small (I'm 5' 9") and I couldn't fit. I only recommend this hotel if you could get a very good deal on the rate.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Bromeisl
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel through the Singapore Airlines stopover deal and as such good value. To book directly, i.e. when enquiring the price at reception, considerably less attractive. Late checkout after 13:00h only for S$ 90 plus tax & service, being stiff. Room 1201 was considered upgrade to executive, would not like to have experienced standard room. Hotel 3 star not 4, in all aspects. Staff generally very friendly, reception staff could do with some customer focus training.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Studon Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Second time visit to this hotel. Although a change of name, no obvious upgrade improvements evident apart from reception moved to ground floor.Bar area cordoned off, I presume for upgrade. We had a room upgrade to executive class on floor 16, but didn't equate to its title. Room clean and tidy,towels still embossed with "Allson" logo. Furniture old and heavy dark wood looking. No radio in room, TV (old crt tv) channel selection not as good as previous stay. A smell of paint in corridors may indicate refurbishment on other floors. Reception and concierge staff most pleasant and very helpful. The hotel is not far from the tube (MRT) and there are bus stops a few yards along Victoria St. and on the other side of the road. Close to shopping areas and 10 mins walk from Raffles Hotel. John

Reviews.Title: “Good location - overall a comfortable short stay”
Reviews.Author: WeLoveBali2
Reviews.Content: Room 709 - 2 night Singapore Airlines Stopover - room only This hotel has obviously been around for a while and the dark furnishings seem a littlle dated - but the room was clean, well equipped and comfortable with great air conditioning and a good firm mattress on the bed I used. Location is good - easy access to MTR stations and many buses run along Victoria Street and both transport options are very easy to use. Plenty of eating options close by and not far to walk to access the free SQ hop on hop off sightseeing bus Too wet to use the pool unfortunately but it looked great - and the one meal I had in the restaurant - late lunch after 1 pm check out - was fine - with very efficient service and freindly local fellow diners My only real disappointment would be the incredible change in the level of friendliness/helpfulness of the concierge staff when they learnt I didn't plan to book tours this trip - but do independent trips on public transport (to Kranji and Changi). Obviously they are on a commission - but they should appreciate that return travellers - don't always want to be herded around in a crowd

Reviews.Title: “Good location clean and amazing pool”
Reviews.Author: Global_Traveller_X
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the grand pacific for 5 nights. The hotel is smart.and clean. They are cleaning and upgrading the exterior which looks good but I felt the room I was in was still dated. I was in a no smoking room but the room clearly had been smoked in for a long time previously as you could still smell it. The pool is wonderful and very clean. The staff were very friendly. I didn't use the restraint but the bar on the ground floor was good with nice food. Overall a nice hotel about 2 minutes walk from raffles but needs the rooms to be modernised.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull hotel, great room, service, and location.”
Reviews.Author: taniagordonw
Reviews.Content: We would recommend this hotel to anyone, we stayed for 8 nights and received the best quality service from happy , helpful staff. All staff members from any department were excellent, we can not say enought about how good this hotel is. Location in Singapore was ideal, close to every thing.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, quiet, clean, comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: fussy_traveller_oz
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, got a free room upgrade as they were out of standard rooms. Had buffet breakfast included as part of our stay with adequate selection of food. Room was quiet, clean and comfortable. Close to train station, Bugis Village and Museum. Staff were helpful and friendly. Good middle-of-the-range hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a nice no frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: postnote
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, staff friendly and food good. Although our room was on the top floor it was large and clean. The down side it did back onto the lift shaft and felt the each time used there where earth quake tremors Overall a nice no frills hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location, next to subway, has laundrette, exercise rm, pool.”
Reviews.Author: Alybruin
Reviews.Content: Very nice and elegant hotel. Breakfast is good and plentiful but very similar items everyday. Located right next to the Bras Rasah subway station, less than 5 minutes walk. No sauna but there's a swimming pool, an exercise rm with treadmill and cycling machines, and they have washer/dryer on the property. No wifi, only wired internet. Service is excellent. There's a huge food court selling Chinese/Indian/other ethnic fast food located literally next to the hotel. These are the best places to eat in Singapore b/c they're good and cheap. This hotel is pricey but if you want a cheaper hotel in the same location, try the Victoria Hotel next door. It doesn't look like much but same location and I bet it's way cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for quick stopover”
Reviews.Author: CalHorn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of the SIA stopover package. The location is the main reason for stayin here- 5 mins from Bugis and another MRT close by. The rooms were fine, we did not have a refurbished one but ok none the less. We had to move rooms after the first night as we were disturbed all night by the air con noise from outside, but that wasn't an issue and we were all moved in 30 mins. The staff were very pleasant and helpful, we can't comment on the food as we did not eat there. We would stay again though as the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaKel
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and overall it was a very good experience. Staff were all friendly. The room was a good size for Asia with a comfortable queen size bed. The hotel is on a main road but we found it to be very quiet. There is a hawker centre next door with good cheap food and also a 7/11 shop. The nearest MRT is Bras Basah which was about a 5 minute walk. We had breakfast included and it was of a good standard. Bugis Street is one block away with its numerous shops and restaurants. We would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “DECENT VALUE, GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: CanberraSteve38
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Pacific (ex Allson) Hotel as part of the Singapore Stopover Package. We didn't get one of the hotel's refurbished rooms but it was comfortable, well maintained and well presented. Check-in was efficient. Breakfast at the Sun Cafe downstairs was not exceptional but it was more than decent. The hotel's location is superb: an interesting area, within walking distance of the colonial district and Orchard Road and, thanks to the new Bras Basah MRT station nearby, close to the rest of Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: ellok
Reviews.Content: The Grand Pacific hotel is a good choice for a central place in Singapore. As a point of sleeping and you can easily escape out into the city life of S'pore. It is situated near MRT stations and there are bus stops just outside the hotel. The rooms are standard, but without WiFi. You can buy access through cable. The breakfast is average, with just the necessary. The staf was very helpful and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “We will be staying again”
Reviews.Author: Mollylovestotravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights as part of our honeymoon and would happily stay again. The room was a good size, bed comfy, everything clean & in order. The pool area looked a bit tired but was clean & tidy and we had the whole pool to ourselves most times. The location is excellent - 5min walk in one direction to Raffles City shopping centre, the Raffles Hotel & one MRT line, or 5min walk in the other direction to Bugis Junction shopping centre & another MRT line. Gallery & museum also walking distance. We didn't eat in the hotel as it was a bit pricey and there is such excellent Hawker food to be had close by.

Reviews.Title: “Good Solution for Business Travellers”
Reviews.Author: Sneggle
Reviews.Content: The Grand Pacific is a newly renovated Business Hotel. The rooms are ok (at least, if they face backwards), there is everything you expect from a hotel aiming at business travellers. Nice small pool with afternnoon sun between the skyscrapers, good place to relax. Wide choice of food for breakfast (european and asian and indian style). Good value for price.

Reviews.Title: “better than what anyone can get in that price.”
Reviews.Author: kaliedo
Reviews.Content: service was excellent. the staff extremely helpful and courteous. our stay was 3 weeks and it felt like home. room was spick and cleaned vey well daily. locaion couldnt get ny better. saved a lot of money on taxis by being within walking distance of most important places. for farther places the bs stop was right outside. bird park and zoo shuttles came to the hotel too.the best part was the self service laundry at the pool. i would swim with my two kids while the clothes were in the washer. with kids you definitely need a laundry if your stay is 3 weeks. only had their breakfast which was very good. our friends also stayed there on our recommendation and loved it too.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, middle of the road hotel”
Reviews.Author: Surreyfamily89
Reviews.Content: Small but comfortable rooms, typical for the city. Decor a bit jaded - needs updating. Reception staff surprisingly unhelpful until pushed. Good location, especially if you are only staying for 1 or 2 days. Excellent outdoor swimming pool, which is a bonus after a hot and sticky day out, and also an excellent place to pass time after check out if you have a late flight, especially with children.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel was so loud I had to wear earplugs”
Reviews.Author: jobeNelsonNewZealand
Reviews.Content: The first room that we looked at was so noisy from the generator as was the second one then they upgraded us to another noisy room that smelt of smoke which we were told on our last day was the smokers floor(we are non smokers). The airconditioner was slow and noisy as well, luckily I had some earplugs in my bag or I would not have been able to sleep in that room either. The older women on the reception was abrupt and not at all helpful where as the Porters were SO helpful and went out of their way to assist. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Great food”
Reviews.Author: Toscaman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel after picking it from many I reviewed on Travel Advisor. I arrived on Mon pm from a flight from Beijing and was quickly processed into my room. I was extremely happy with my room. I had meals in The Brasserie because this is what my Package included. The service was prompt and the staff eager to help and also very friendly. The hotel is central and close to MRT stations at Bungis and City Hall. There is a Burger King and a 7 Eleven store nearby so this is also a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: singaporeboy79
Reviews.Content: The hotel Grand Pacific was quite a surprise, I didnt expect that it would be so good. It is located nearby the Bugis metro station and very near all the sight seeing places in the inner town. Great hotel for a reasonable price. Rooms have been renovated also, and everything is clean.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Olana_10
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed on our arrival, we were not received very well by reception. The bedroom was another disappointment. (Nothing like the photographs shown) Our double bed was as hard as a brick, the pillows were also old and hard.There was a bar fridge with nothing in it. We had two hard back chairs which were very uncomfortable to sit on. A small television with only two stations that were in English. The bathroom was ok but very small.We had a good laugh at the sign in the breakfast area which said there would be a $3.00 charge per 100 grams of food wastage. The couple sitting next to us at breakfast had to move quickly as water started to come through the roof. We spent as much of our time away from the place as we could. We were only there for 4 days thank goodness. We will go back to Singapore again as we loved it, but will make sure we are as far away from this hotel as possible.

Reviews.Title: “In line with expectations”
Reviews.Author: pamarx200
Reviews.Content: My response to those complaining about this hotel is that you get what you pay for. The hotel -- being just around the corner from the MRT, Chjimes, Bugis junction shopping, the Raffles and Intercon hotels, AND Raffles City Place – is well situated. Clearly, either you pay for that or compromise on other aspects. The hotel is not luxurious, but considering that the prices are low to middle 4 star for Singapore, it’s not bad. Everything works, the room is well lighted and has all the facilities , the bed is comfortable, the amenities are adequate, there is a small clean pool and a workout room. The staff do their best considering the price paid. I found it notable that in addition to the usual signs to conserve water by reusing towels and sheets, this hotel also provided two wastebaskets: one for regular and the other, with a big recycle sign on it, for recyclables. This is notable because while hotels save money when guests re-use towels and sheets, and thus have an incentive to “be green”, in this case by recycling trash, they don’t actually “get” anything. It shows a different degree of commitment. In short, the hotel is nothing to write home, about but for the price paid, does the job.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Addicts97
Reviews.Content: We were put up here by Singapore Airlines, ok it was free but I would have preferred to pay money to stay elsewhere. Hotel is rated 4 star, obviously we weren't put in those rooms. I would rate the room we stayed in as 1-2 star, bathroom was dirty and the toilet looked like it had been put in by anyone but a plumber. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “NOT THE HOTEL FOR US”
Reviews.Author: happyBundaberg
Reviews.Content: it might be centrum, but no thanks, when we came to our destination, we emailed our travel agent, to change hotel, to when we came back to singapore! there were no servise.

Reviews.Title: “I will stay in this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: cat2x
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the hotel is the location. It's an easy walk to Raffles City, Chimes, and is just 1 block away from the nearest MRT station. There's also a 7-11 beside the hotel. Neighborhood is good. The nearest MRT station to the hotel belongs to the Circle Line. Unfortunately, it's not yet included in the Singapore maps available to tourists. for the first half of our stay, we were walking 2 blocks to get to the City Hall station. Lesson learned: always ask the hotel staff rather than going on your own with a map. The room assigned to us is clean. Our only complain is that there's nowhere to put your toiletries in the shower area. Buffet breakfast is ok - not exceptional, just ok. Hotel personnel are helpful. Overall, we will stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good for money!”
Reviews.Author: Fireworm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Grand Pacific Hotel from the 4th to the 8th of June, 2010, for 4 nights. The location of this hotel is super, basically walking distance (all within 10 mins walk) to the marina, suntec city, raffles hotel, raffles city, chimes (an old church complex turned into restaurants and bars). If you'd like you can walk to Orchard Road shopping area for about 20 mins, or its just 5 mins to the MRT stations and 5 mins MRT ride away. The staff were pretty friendly during our stay. At first they might seem rude/offish (with a standard poker face) but, don't let the poker faces put you off, if you say hi and engage with them we found that they were usually very friendly. The staff helped us with our tours, rooms, taxis... with no drama. We also got some surprise discounts from booking tours through the hotel staff. I've read ppl complaining about the firm bed at this hotel. Yes, the bed matress was quite firm but not unbearable. However, the air-con.... was way too cold and non-adjustable. Once it hit the desired temp (i.e. 20 degree) it cut off completely, without any air circluation and didn't come back on unless you turn it down again (i.e. down to 15). Overall, our experience with Grand Pacific was a very good and pleasant one. Considering the price you pay for accommodations in SIN. This is a hotel with good value.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Encedalus
Reviews.Content: I booked Grand pacific hotel (formerly Alson) during my buisness trip to Singapore. On arrival to my surprise I was already upgraded to an executive room...great way to start! The hospitality is unmatched. The room service is excellent and the staffs were very freindly. They have a good restaurant where you can start your day with a nice breakfast. The hotel is very close to public transport and there are ample taxis...so you are never far from the city attractions. The location also offers you great shopping. All in all staying at Grand Pacific was worth. Thanks to tripadvisor for the genuine review about this hotel which helped me in booking and thanks to the Alson group for making my stay enjoyable and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: mplstraveller
Reviews.Content: This place was just fine, but not worth the money. Room was nice, bathroom was very basic, and staff are mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet and comfy room, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: RoyTA
Reviews.Content: Hotel Grand Pacific (formerly Allson) is located on Victoria Street and I find it a tag closer to City Hall MRT station than Bugis station, both within 10 minutes walk anyway. There is a hawker centre right beside it. Convenient store and internet café could be found across the street on the ground level of Bras Basah Complex. My plane touched down after midnight and I took a taxi to the hotel which cost me a little more than S$20. The bellhop was enthusiastic and helpful, and the staff member at the check in counter, an older gentleman, friendly and polite. While he may not be as sharp and efficient as his counterparts in the likes of Swissotel The Stamford, he was certainly not as cold and mechanic. The lift service there employs a "card system" where one may have to insert the room card into a slot before the lift could be operated. The card is only required for ascending to a guest room floor and not for descending. The room that I stayed in was a Premier. It was very clean, odour free and quiet. The bed was comfy and the furniture and fittings well maintained. At 13th floor facing Victoria Street, the view was nothing to brag about, but then you could not have asked for more at this price level. The toothpaste they provided was the smallest I've seen, enough to brush your teeth for two times at most, and it was packed together with a toothbrush, meaning that you have to open a new pack just because you need more toothpaste, where is the sense in this? I checked out early in the morning and it was as fast as it should be. Overall I was very happy with the room and found their service very good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: warrenmoodie
Reviews.Content: Previously called the Allson.We stayed for 4 days and on arrival was updated to an executive room which was excellent.The staff were always very friendly and nothing was a problem.They organised all our trips with a minimum of fuss.The buffet breakfast was quite ok but lacking the quality of some hotels. The hotel price was in our package so I'm not sure of the actual cost to us.Prices were displayed and rooms were not cheap like all accomodation in Singapore.The location just off Orchard Road and a block from the Bugis Markets was great.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: bkap_007
Reviews.Content: The hotels location is great, next to national library. Not a very plush hotel though. Has a restaurant. Breakfast is also ok but not the best. Gym , swimming pool not worth the time. Rooms are average but clean, staff is also good

Reviews.Title: “value for money, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: PeeOnTree
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with partner and young kid for a few nights whilst we explored singapore. Great value for money. Double bed, small-ish room, no complaints. Hawker market downstairs for meals. Short taxi rides to Chinatown and Orchard room.

Reviews.Title: “Never again, very disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: KJM_8
Reviews.Content: We recently had five nights at the Grand Pacific (formerly Allson) and we were very disappointed! Every day we complained that the toilet wouldn't flush and it was eventually fixed the day before we left! The safe didn't work! The bed was very uncomfortable due to the firmness! We were woken through the night from the noise due to people flushing toilets or using the shower! The only good thing about this hotel is the location!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel on Fire - Staff run away!”
Reviews.Author: wilrc1
Reviews.Content: Oh my god where do i start?????? I stayed in this 'hotel' last night 6th April 2010 to be woken by a short burst of fire alarm, then silence. Ten minutes later all the power goes off, even emergency lighting, I managed to find my way down 6 floors to the lobby, opening the door into thick black smoke, I found no staff, they had all disappeared, sitting outside at 5am in the darkness, we soon realized we were on our own, one staff member, a porter, turned up about an hour later and herded everyone to the site of the fire! at the back of the hotel, the police were not happy but we saw the extent of the fire, this was a big big fire, fire engines and police everywhere. A few hours later I returned to the hotel, they were giving out flashlights and when asked said it could be hours or days till the power was back on, No Refunds though! was quickly added!!!! So to summarize, DO NOT STAY HERE, Its dangerous, the staff disappear first sign of trouble, the rooms are small, dark and pokey!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: flavia_1973
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at Grand Pacific (former Allson) Hotel, inside a package "Singapore Stopover" with Singapore Airlines. Our room was quite big, comfortable and clean. There is a safe, a fridge and complimentary water. Breakfast was excluded from our package but we paid for it. Continental breakfast is poor/basic (tea/coffee, croissant, fruit salad), full english breakfast is surely better if you're hungry in the morning. The location is very good, in Colonial Distric, not far from Marina Bay, Esplanade, Little India, Arab Street. We went walking in these places and we caught the MRT/bus only to go farther. The staff is very kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: jimbo46WestAustralia
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Furniture a little old but ok. Breakfast was excellent. Staff very friendly and helpful especially Mano.He is a wealth of Knowledge. Take his advice on any tours we did'nt and wished we had. Would stay there again. Great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: LancashireFemale
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night in February en route to Australia & 1 night in March on our return home.The first room was jaded & needed a complete revamp, the carpet was dirty & the bathroom cracked & horrible. The second room was an upgrade, which was at the back, & much better quality, unfortunately building work was going on at the back until late at night so we didn't get much sleep. Would not stay again. The location is good

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location - Friendly Staff - 3 Star Hotel - Tips & Comments”
Reviews.Author: gribbsfam
Reviews.Content: Recently, my husband and I stayed at this hotel. Accommodation in Singapore is (as a rule) quite expensive as compared to other Asian cities ie Bangkok or KL. However, our travel agent booked this hotel (room + breakfast) for a better rate than I could book with the Internet. After an efficient pass through Customs and Immigration, we caught the airport train (SGD $2.60 x 2 + $1 x2 refundable deposits) to Bugis MRT (train station - could have got off at City Hall MRT station which is also close to the hotel and is a central MRT to other lines traversing the city) and after a 1/4 hour wait in a queue, we caught a taxi (SGD $7.80) to the hotel which was closeby. The MRT is easy to understand and clean/safe. Hotel checkin was pleasant, efficient and we were given a room (# 616 - a quiet, large twin bed room, at the back of the hotel away from the street noise of busy Victoria Street and on a non-smoking floor - as in most of Asia's hotels, the mattress was very 'firm'). The hotel has 16 floors and there is a laundry where you can do your own washing/drying, but we only had a few days here and had no need to use this facility. There are 3 elevators. The rooms are circa 1970-1990 but clean!! Breakfast is served in the Sun Cafe (a choice of Asian or Western-style breakfasts. A food station where you can order your choice of freshly cooked eggs + bacon is also in this area.) Next door on one side of the hotel is a 7-11 store and on the other, a food hawker centre (had dinner here one night, but it was pretty average - maybe we chose the wrong menue or stall??) Bugis Markets are a few blocks walk from the hotel. We changed a $100 Aussie dollars on arrival at the airport, but then checked out the currency exchanges in the Bugis Markets and changed more dollars at the best rates there (both had no commission).. Lots of cheap (and nasty??) goods (bags/shoes/clothes - in small sizes!) for sale at the Markets but handy for gifts (cheap watches are SGD$5 or 3 bracelets = $SGD10) for the neighbours' small children back home. If you like MotherCare (for children/grandchildren goods and clothing) I found at least one store. Lots of the stores were having 20 - 70% sales when we were in S/Pore at the end of February/beginning of March. You can eat cheaply in Singapore at the numerous shopping centres (Bugis Junction is near the hotel). Look for Food Republic outlets in many of the shopping centres - there are all types of reasonably priced food venues all in one area - Indian/Thai/Indonesian/Korean/Malay + dessert counters. The Singapore Flyer has great views of the city and surrounds and if you present your Singapore Airlines boarding passes, you will get 20% off (SGD$47.20 for 2 people). We went on a Fun Vee City Tour hop on/hop off bus (SGD$19.90 x2 - this was a 'special' for 48 hours!!) + 1/2 hour river cruise (SGD$5 x2). There was a poor (if any) commentary on most of the buses we joined but for 2 days, we travelled all over the city, getting off and on at will. Be prepared to wait 15-30 mins for the buses! On leaving Singapore, it took 20 mins from the hotel to the airport (SGD$13.40 - we gave him $SGD20 as he was a guided tour on the way (better than Fun Vee Tour commentary)!! Harrods/Prada/Levis/perfumeries et etc etc are among the stores at the International Airport. ***WARNING: Don't get 'ripped off' at Newton's Food (Newtons MRT) -where ther are lots of food outlets, all touting for your business - it cost us $SGD105 for dinner for 2, on the last night and this was for 4 cooked prawns (SGD$8/100grams), a plate of calamari and rice + 2 soft drinks!!! Get a price BEFORE they cook and serve your meal - then at the end, they present you with the bill!!! We had no money left and had to cash more AUD$ after this costly experience!! WE WILL NEVER RETURN HERE AND WILL ADVISE ALL AND SUNDRY OF THE COST!! It was daylight (okay, so it was night time!) robbery....! Singapore can be cheap to eat, if you watch where the locals choose. We found Singapore to be clean and friendly and safe - just "stung" with the nasty surprise at Newton's!! As Singapore is hot and humid, watch your prices on bottled water - we paid anything from $SGD1 to SGD$3 per bottle and try to get a hotel with a pool (even a small pool as is the case at the Grand Pacific) for cooling off at the end of a busy day! Apologies for the lengthy commentary, but any information gained may help someone with their travel plans! Enjoy Singapore....

Reviews.Title: “beds are extremely hard”
Reviews.Author: SydneyOwleyes
Reviews.Content: Spent one night in deluxe, although paid for premier room 2 nights in premier which was nicely appointed but found beds exceptionally hard. Position is good. Breakfast just satisfactory.Very clean. Pool is accessed by steep stairs from level above.Once a lovely hotel but run down now.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Gus15
Reviews.Content: After a long flight we arrived at the hotel at 6:30am and were prompetly check in. The room was great - comfortable bed and good finishings. The location was great - 5 mins walking to Raffles Hotel and 2 mins from the MRT/Buses to get around. The breakfast in the morning was presented very well and the staff are only to willing to help if you have questions about Singapore. All in all a great hotel and would recommed it to any body looking for a hotel in good location.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: WigglyWorld
Reviews.Content: This hotel is now called the Grand Pacific Hotel. I booked this hotel as part of a 1 night Singapore Airlines stopover deal. I originally paid $AUD232 for a triple room. Singapore Airlines then had a $1 / night stopover deal, so I was able to cancel my original booking and re-book (all online) for $AUD3 including hotel and all the stopover vouchers. The hotel is very well located. It only took us about 30 minutes to walk slowly down through the City Hall area to Raffles Landing Place on the river. There are many conveniences near the hotel, including a 7-11 right next door open 24 hours for all your essentials (making for a cheap snack or breakfast option too). Even though we arrived at the hotel after 2:00pm, our room wasn't ready and the reception staff were not very useful in letting us know how long it would be for the room to be ready - they just told us to take a seat. After 30 minutes of now news, we left out bags to start exploring the city as we only had 24 hours in Singapore. Other than this small disappointment, our room was OK - not flash, bit dated, tight squeeze for a triple but remember this was only a stopover, even at the normal price I understand this is good value for Singapore and the location was good. We were leaving at 5pm the following day. The hotel kindly held our bags and allowed us to shower and change in the pool shower (with use of the pool towels). No need for late checkout especially given we were out for most of the day. I think this hotel still represents pretty good value and a good choice for a stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Busy Location”
Reviews.Author: HighwaySingapore
Reviews.Content: A very practical and economical hotel in expensive Singapore. Located right at the city centre it’s easily accessible by taxi, train and bus services. Staff are friendly. Food is above average. Rooms are very decent and clean. It’s the perfect hotel if you want to visit Singapore for business or site seeing as a group.

Reviews.Title: “A miserable, yet clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: gracepgold
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Allson -through Singapore Airlines Stopover deal, on return leg of Europe flight in November. Originally I had booked the room as a single traveller. We ended up being charged and extra S$70 for my husband to stay! This was handled very badly by rude, disinterested and cranky front of house staff. The room was large and clean but decorated by someone in the 1970s and not updated since. The bathroom was spacious and very clean - but the shower recess was severely damaged and a botch job had been done to cover it up. Strange padlocked cupboard in the bathroom too. Hard to get taxi from this hotel. We will not bother again. They were miserable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: victa65
Reviews.Content: Purchased a great accommodation deal thru SIA Holidays and chose the Allson Hotel as it was the cheapest 3-star option and the TA reviews generally gave it a decent score. The deal included airport transfers and a half-day city tour and one nights free accommodation. When I arrived at the hotel, the concierge on the 1st floor (Ground floor for Oz travellers) offered to hold my luggage whilst I checked-in at reception which was up the escalator on the 2nd floor (1st floor). The receptionist was quite indifferent, unforunately. She hardly looked at me and I had difficulty understanding her English (probably my fault there). So I refrained from asking her too many questions. However, the process was quick and efficient. I discovered that I was upgraded to a Premier room as there weren`t any smoking rooms available for my 5 day stay. As mentioned in previous reviews, the smoking floor hallway had a strong residual aroma of smoke, but surprisingly not in the room. The room was on the 8th floor and had a view to the south where I could see a quarter of the Flyer thru the vista of skyscrapers. It was well appointed, functional and very clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. The room-controlled air-con provided a wonderful refuge from the oppressive heat that Singapore can provide. The hotel pool was also a welcome relief. Accessed from the 5th floor corridor, you take the outside stairs down to level 4. It`s mostly exposed to the sun but there are areas of shade and blue pool towels are available for guests. Daytours from Allson may mean a pickup from outside the adjoining hotel at the rear - Hotel Royal @ Queens. It backs on to the Allson and is on Queen St. Access is thru the sliding doors on the reception level past the tour desk. This also makes it convenient if you`re going to visit places north of Victoria St. There is an evening bar on this level as well. As a guest, I was able to enjoy the breakfast buffet at half-price (SGD18) in the hotel`s Café Fontainebleau which also operates buffets for lunch and dinner - plus set menus. The staff there are very welcoming and attentive. The food was varied and plentiful. Western and Asian palates are catered for, but the quality I`d say was only average. There is another, more formal and upmarket, restaurant attached to the hotel as well. My accommodation deal afforded me the slightly later checkout time of midday. It also provided the option of an even later checkout (up to 4pm) subject to Allson`s availablilty. As I was not departing for the airport until 6pm, I requested this option the day before and reception graciously allowed me a 3pm checkout. The TV even counted down before switching off 25 mins before checkout time. It certainly gave me a hurry on. They have a luggage holding system and they also advised that there were shower facilities available for checked-out guests before their departure from the hotel. As I was fortunate to receive an upgrade from my booked Deluxe room, a lot of my expectations were often surpassed in that capacity. But the general service, facilities and features of the hotel were excellent. Its location is practically perfect. So when you look at all the Allson has to offer, it is extremely good value. I`d certainly stay there again and would definitely recommend it to others… even without a special deal.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Sue1107
Reviews.Content: We arrived fairly early in the morning and were greeted by very friendly staff. We were given an upgraded room on the 10th floor which was very plesant. The hotel is in an ideal location for exploring this wonderful city. We stayed for 1 week and wish it could have been longer, The hotel is very convenient for public transport and is within walking distance of Raffles and the Singapore Flyer - both are not to be missed on a trip to this city. The room was cleaned thoroughly every day and the pool, although small, was very nice. Next door is a 7/11 store which is handy and next door to that is a small bar/restaurant called The Taverna that does very nice snacks and light meals at very resonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulscan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allson on our Singapore stopover for 2 nights. We arived at the hotel at 7.30am and we were greeted by friendly staff at reception. We were given our room straight away which was greatly appreciated after a long flight overnight. Our room was quite spacious and very clean. There was no noise and we slept till 12 noon without interuption. Bedding was very good. The bathroom is a little dated but still quite good.
