Location of the hotel is excellent with nice eating places close by. There is a 7 Eleven store next door to buy any goods you want. Travelled to the Zoo by taxi for $$15 and the hop on hop off bus is only one block away. For money exchange we got a better rate outside the hotel in changing $AUS to SS$. Would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again and would recommend it to our friends. Paul

Reviews.Title: “you may not get what you booked”
Reviews.Author: lesley1944
Reviews.Content: arrrived after all night flight from manchester to be told by rude receptionist, our rom would not be available till 11am,offered us a smokers room of the same category which we declined. We had to pay more dollars to get an upgraded room, so we could get some rest. very poor start to our first trip to singapore

Reviews.Title: “Well placed hotel, comfortable and clean. Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jennyw6
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Allson two nights on route back to Australia. Hotel clean, comfortable, rooms quite large, beds comfortable. Cleaning staff thorough. No mini bar but fridge in room. Nice bathroom bit small. Hairdryer. Bit of a walk to the MRT system which works really well. Easy walking distance, next street to Raffles and Raffles city shopping centre. Had an enjoyable stay. Nice swimming pool and small fitness centre. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The not so awesome Allson...”
Reviews.Author: MrADuff
Reviews.Content: We did the Singapore stop over package for 3 nights. We picked the Allson Hotel becaus it was in the B class ranking. Average price range and seemed like a nice hotel on paper. We were not impressed by the hotel in general. Rooms were BAD... Breakfast was very bad.. We will not be going back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: irvine33
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel at about 6pm and was made to feel very welcome. We went to the Flyer from the hotel and it is well worth the trip. The rooms are good although the bathroom is a bit on the small size. The service of the hotel is good and the staff very helpful especially an Indian porter called Mano who is a wealth of information on where to go and how to get there. Hotel also has its own laundrete but you need own powder and its $6 singapore for a wash and the same again for dryers coins can be obtained from reception on the 2nd floor. There is a nice little bar on the right hand side of the hotel and is next to the 711. If looking for a shop for purfume would suggest you go to a place called Jasina its at the High Street Centre just passed the traffic light on High St and North Bridge Road across from the Parliament House it is very good value. Walk up stairs at North bridge Rd and is 1st shop on left. The hotel is well located and within reach of most attractions for Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but great location”
Reviews.Author: doc1234
Reviews.Content: we had read a lot of bad reviews abt the Allson and were quite apprehensive about what we would find, but when we reached there we found that we were upgraded from a deluxe to a premier room. the room was ok. buffet breakfast is standard with baked beans , eggs, noodles, cereals but isn't worth the S$ 30 (half price for hotel guests). the best thing about the hotel is the great location. it is quite close to orchard road which is touted as THE road to go if you are looking for shopping malls. you can either take a cab or use the metro which is very affordable (ticket for S$2 of which you are refunded with S$1 when you return the ticket) . on our way to sentosa and the zoo we realised that a lot of other hotels were located in the residential areas from where getting to malls would be difficult. a 24 hour 7/11 store nearby provied the necessary amenities. NOT the hotel you want to book if your planning to stay IN the hotel but as stopover hotel it isn't that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Unhelpful and unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: Borntotravel09
Reviews.Content: This hotel was part of a Qantas package stop over. On arrival asked for a different room due to it being on a smoking floor. When arriving in the room there were no towels. It was extremely humid and hot and after 9 hours just wanted a shower. Picked up the phone and there was no dial tone. Walked down to the service counter and was told towels would be up and phone to be fixed. 1 hour later nothing ,so walked back down and check in staff very snappy and pre-occupied with other things. Finally got towels but phone took 5 hours to fix. Central air conditioning was not very good and the room was way too warm for my liking. Morning breakfast was below average. Final insult was late flight and asking for 2-3 hours longer in the room only to be told you had to pay the full half day rate. This hotel in my personal case had many downsides and perhaps people were just having an off day or I was unlucky with the room assigned but I would certainly not be going there again and would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: janetbell1624
Reviews.Content: good rooms, friendly staff, good singers? in the bar,good breakfast ,excellant location

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyer078
Reviews.Content: Took a weeks holiday in Singapore and decided to stay at the Allson. On check in, the lady at reception was very pleasant and advised me that I had been upgraded to a premier room on the 15th floor, given the fact that they were fully booked, which was very nice. The room was good and the bed was comfortable, with LCD TV, desk and armchair. View wasn't anything spectacular, but it was OK. In terms of facilities, the pool was great, water was the right temp and is very inviting to escape the heat and humidity. The food however at the restaurant, could have been a bit better, but that is my only real gripe. Staff very friendly and said good morning to all the guests everyday. One doorman in particular, a well built Indian gentleman was extremely nice, advising on a couple of occasions on what buses/train to catch to where I was going etc. Good location, close to all amenities (7/11 right outside) as well as a bus stop and it is about a 10 minute walk to the Bugis MRT. If I am ever in Singapore again, I will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very happy stay in the Allson”
Reviews.Author: rayking102
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Allson for 10 days in April this year and could not fault the service,cleanliness ,and overall service in this hotel, from the time we arrived with our luggage we found nothing but helpful staff, at breakfast the staff were allways helpful and nothing seemed to be to much trouble, even the room cleaning staff always had a smile, the room was perfectly adequate for the two of us, and the location was superb, if you needed a taxi it was no trouble, and the public transport in both Bras Basah Road and Victoria Street was marvellous, and the M.R.T.was just a short walk away in Raffles city.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing majorly wrong with this place - but nothing really right either”
Reviews.Author: kiwistee
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as part of the Singapore Airlines Stopover Holiday package. I have no complaints about the service by the staff in this hotel and no horror stories about my stay. It's just that this hotel left me a bit disappointed. Especially after the superior quality of places I stayed at in other parts of Asia that were actually cheaper. Singapore hotels are ridiculously expensive and overpriced. The bathroom needed renovating and had a horrible unattractive padlocked trapdoor on one of the walls. Cheap paintjob on walls and ceiling where you could see missed patches of old paint. The corridors smelt musty and the place had a run down feel to it inside despite a makeover on the exterior. Got breakfast in the hotel restaurant at half price which was well worth it. Had a good selection of dishes to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnnieB70
Reviews.Content: All the staff were terrific, my room on the 6th floor was clean and better than some more expensive hotels I have stayed at in Singapore. The position is good. Even for someone like myself, using a walking stick, it was only 5-10 minutes to City Hall or Bugis MRTs. On the way to Raffles City there is a very cheap internet cafe and plenty of food places nearby, including a food court one side, and a 711 store and cheap cafe the other. The only down side I found was , having saved 6 dollar coins to use the washing machine in the laundry, it was another 6 to use the dryer. However, I took the wet clothes back to my room where there was a extending line over the bath and at the advice of a very friendly room cleaner [Mei Chan], phoned for extra hangers for my shirts etc. Overall, a great 11 days stay and I would certainly recommend The Allson to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Amy3000
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here in March 2009. On arrival we were upgraded to a premier room which was located towards the top of the building giving it some wonderful views across to the Singapore Flyer. The room was a decent size for 2 people with a king size bed, the bathroom was a little on the small size but adequate for our purposes. It wasn't the world's flashest hotel but it was clean, comfortable and a great location. The hotel was only a short walk from the City Hall or Bugis MRT which was the main attraction for us in a hotel (that and the price!.) There was a food court next door too - we didn't try it as we ran out of time (kept thinking that as it was only next door we could just pop down there whenever!) There were some good cheap food places within walking distance which was ideal, Chijmes was withing walking distance too if you are wanting to eat some "western" food but we did find it more expensive. The pool was also a must to help us deal with the heat and humidity - most times we were down there it was fairly quiet, only about 5 or 6 other people at the most so made for a relaxing hour or so in the middle of the afternoon. I much prefer this area of Singapore to stay in after walking down Orchard road and seeing what chaos and how expensive most of it is so would defintately come back to this hotel in future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ad-rhett
Reviews.Content: We had 2 nights at the Allson and from the moment we walked thru the doors we were impressed. We had just arrived from an all night flight and were eager to get in our room & get some sleep. They were very understanding and in an hour we had our room. We had a standard queen room, very clean, decent size, nice furnishings and the bathroom had been recently renovated. (see photos) Overall its great location to get around, the MRT station is 2 minutes walk away as is the Raffles Plaza shopping centre. Singapore is so easy to get around & after a full day's site seeing we came back to the hotel & chilled out in the pool. Breakfast is pretty standard & there is a fabulous food court next to the hotel where we had a great meal off one of the stalls. We loved our stay & will definately be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “No frills hotel.”
Reviews.Author: harry_the_haddock
Reviews.Content: After a full days travelling we arrived at the Allson to be told that they had no non smoking rooms that first night,(we booked 6 months prior) but could swap the second night. to a non smoking room. The hotel was clean, although you could detect the stale smell of smoke on the floor our room was on and also in the room. The room itself was clean although fittings were stained with tar. Generally the staff were friendly, but reception staff were probably not the most helpful we have come across. However we found the concierge to be extremely helpful and a great character and we bought our tickets for the Singapore Flier from him, this included a free pack.The hotel is in a great location, short walking distance to Raffles hotel and shopping mall and Chjimes bar complex.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful friendly Hotel, we loved every minute of it.”
Reviews.Author: Galaxymooncat
Reviews.Content: We thouroughly enjoyed our stay at this friendly and very relaxing hotel. The rooms were clean and very comfortable. Coffee making facility in the rooms also, great. The restaurant food was lovely and the staff were all very friendly, polite and most willing to help. The doormen and desk staff were very helpful. They booked daily tours for us and even posted all our shopping home to New Zealand for us which made our holiday so much more enjoyable. Mano was wonderful and made us all feel so very welcome. The little shop on the first floor was a joy and offered everything from souveniers to cotton and needles. Overall this hotel was wonderful and we would most certainly stay there again. We thoroughly recommend it to other people looking for value for money, a friendly atmosphere and a relaxing holiday. Thanks again Mano you were awesome.

Reviews.Title: “What a great holiday!”
Reviews.Author: karenp5433
Reviews.Content: Loved every minute of it! My mother and I stayed here many years ago and thought we would stay again this time. Fantastic location - close to Bugis Street markets, Raffles, Orchard Road all in walking distance. Staff were friendly and helpful, a great food court next door which we ate at most days - inexpensive and good food. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable, although the bathroom was a little on the small side. Would definately stay here again - we had a great time. The buffet breakfast was also reasonable and the front door staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location + Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Oluf
Reviews.Content: Last September we booked an eight day "Singapore Swing" package with Silkway Travel in Vancouver to coincide with the Chinese New Year's Spring Festival. Lucky we went then. Singapore International Airlines (SIA) has since suspended flights from Vancouver effective April 2009. We initially checked the Trip Advisor rating of each of the hotels offered on the package. Allson Hotel had both the best TA rating and the most reasonable price. As first time visitors to Singapore we quickly realized that the Allson was the best location we could have chosen. The famous Raffles Hotel was only a block away, and offered a stop for the SIA hop-on / hop-off bus. Our package included two days worth of free hopping on and off. Two round trips on the SIA bus with the maps they supplied gave us our bearings for the rest of our stay. Our SIA boarding pass also provided for a wide range of further shopping and attraction discounts during our stay. Every morning the door men gave us very helpful suggestions for our shopping and exploring. The Allson is a SIA stop-over hotel. This really means 24 hour service. Our flight was a couple of hours late, making our check-in 2:30 am. Absolutely no problem! Our bags were taken to the room and we were given a quick lesson on use of the room card for both the electricity in our room and for the elevator. There never was hitch in the operation of the three elevators serving us. The in-room safe was easy to use. Our bed was comfortable and we were amazed at how quiet the room was (12th floor) for being in the centre of the City. Large bathroom, adequate furniture, TV, small fridge and coffee maker were handy. The hotel internet was SD20 per day. We just used it once as it turned out we could get free WIFI at a McDonald's a block away. Breakfast was included in our package and included a wide range of delicious western and asian foods. A 24 hour food court is adjacent to the hotel and offers at least eight various asian cuisines. Our favourite was the dim sum. SIA has a tour operator in the hotel which is very handy. He suggested we obtain tickets for the CHINGAY PARADE which is the largest Spring Festival event in Asia. We ended up above the Prime Minister's reviewing stand with an excellent view of the whole parade. WOW!!! We walked from the hotel down to China Town for the arrival of Chinese New Year's. Again WOW!! - largely due to the loudest fireworks we've ever encountered. The hotel was a convenient pick-up spot for the tours we booked. The hotel is just north of the Singapore Business University. The shopping centre across the street from the hotel has several floors of new and used books. Little India and the Malay quarter are only a few blocks away. The gigantic electonics building is only a couple of blocks away. There are hundreds of restaurants and food courts within a few blocks of the Allson. There is also a 24 hour 7/11 adjacent to the hotel. Handy for drinks, etc. We used the 4th floor swimming pool almost every day. For anyone wishing a touch of the sun, it shines through a gap in the surrounding hi-rises from about 10:30 am to 1 pm .People told us that a couple days was more than enough for a visit to Singapore. They were wrong! We look forward to visiting Singapore again to see all the things we missed this time. Shall only hope we can arrange a stay at the Allson again, and that SIA resumes service again from Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be in a better location....”
Reviews.Author: MustangFrank
Reviews.Content: Wife and I went from Australia to Singapore with another couple to do something different for birthday and wedding anniversaries that came up in the first two weeks of 2009. The hotel was chosen by our travel agent as an affordable place to stay, within walking distance of several major shopping centres and eateries. The location in the Singapore CBD was perfect, with a money changer and a 24-hour 7 Eleven next door at the left of the hotel and a large open-air food court to the immediate right. It is just a 5-minute walk to the famous Raffles Hotel and about 15-minutes to the Bugis Street markets and Bugis Junction shopping centre. A cab ride to Chinatown is about $5... actually, nowhere in Singapore is much more than about $10 to $15 by cab and there seems to be more cabs than other cars in the city. I agree with the comments about noise transmission in the Allson. It seems to have been built in two phases ... the original building of solid brick with excellent noise insulation and a high-rise extension with walls of timber studding and plasterboard. Yes, you can hear water running in the pipes when someone showers but not much else. Besides, after a few of those big 633 mil Tiger beers at the food court next door, you won't hear much for the rest of the night:) The full breakfast in the dining room is excellent. if you're lucky, your deal included vouchers for free breakfasts. If not, your travel agent can arrange a 50% discount. That makes all you can eat of Asian and/or Western food for $15 per head...plus 10% service charge, plus 7% GST, which is the norm in Singapore. Truly excellent value and if you eat late and stuff yourself enough, you really don't need lunch. The reception girls are a bit cold but they lighten up if you crack a few funnies. As for the indian/Malay lobby porters - well, what can you say... excellent service, helpful tips - especially from big Mano who is a bit of a legend in the place. Nothing was too hard for him and I hope they give the guy a big pay rise as he did all he could to make our stay very enjoyable. The pool area was basic but very relaxing, with a dozen high-quality lounge chairs to laze about on, plus outdoor seating settings with big umbrellas. The pool was perfectly clean. Allson has an excellent policy of allowing check-out as late as 1:00pm and even when you've left your room, they let you leave your bags in the foyer holding area as long as you like (our airport shuttle wasn't due to collect us till 8:15pm for our return flight.) Also, you can get an electronic key to visit the pool area and use the showers ... this is after you've left the hotel! That's pretty good in my book. Overall, it was excellent for the four of us. The aircon and fridge both worked well and we had a great view. Our rooms did have a few quality issues with materials like ceiling paint flaking away, etc, and the hot water service was struggling a bit to get a good flow to the 16th floor - but if you want 5-star, you gotta pay for it. As a place to crash after walking 10km for the day, sinking a bunch of Tiger beers and stuffing yourself with chilli crab, who needs anything better? As I said earlier, it couldn't be in a better location and that's important when you're doing a lot of walking.

Reviews.Title: “Once registered, great place !”
Reviews.Author: Grenoble-Professor
Reviews.Content: The university I teach at booked the room--supposedly, but the desk claimed never to have heard of me or them! Kept me waiting for 90 minutes, claiming "no room, fully booked for following two weeks." But then they did find the reservation, gave me a room w/o a working A/C, found another room with working A/C, two huge beds,comfortable,excellent bathroom. I found breakfast and lunch very good, the latter somewhat pricey. Much choice at buffet. Reception staff cold, others very friendly. Coming back in 2009 Walter

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not great”
Reviews.Author: pollypiglets
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Allson on Singapore stopover on the way to Australia and on the way back. On arrival at 8am we were received by surly, unhelpful reception staff. We were told to come back at 10am and given a voucher for a free tea or coffee at the buffet restaurant. After availing ourselves of the freebie we still had 90 mins to kill so went for a walk. Arriving back at 10am we went back to reception and asked if our room was ready "no,no not ready yet, come back later" I explained that I had been told our room would be available at 10am so grudgingly they checked and lo and behold our room was ready. Our first room was fine and I really can't complain about it exept that the Singapore stopover rep rang us at 8.15am to ask us to meet with him after breakfast. Then the restaurant rang us at 8.50am to talk us into going down for the buffet breakfast at half price. We had ordered breakfast to have in the room but decided to take them up on their offer. Big mistake, I have never seen such an unappetising mish-mash of food and I am not a fussy eater. In the end we just had poached eggs on toast at 15 dollars each which is what we had ordered in the first place and would have been cheaper in the room. Then it was off to meet the rep to find out what was so important that he had to ring us at 8.15am. He told us what time the coach would be picking us up the next day! and tried to sell us some excursions, which of course was the real reason we were there. After a visit to KFC (beware, if you order a "meal" it doesn't come with chips, you have to order them seperately !!??) we found that we couldn't get into our room, I went to reception and explained our predicament, they looked at me as if I was stupid, fiddled with the key card and sent me back to try it again. No joy, back to reception, more looks of disdain. This time they sent the manager up to try the keycard and show me what an idiot I was. I was highly delighted when after many attempts he had to admit it didn't work and called for the engineer. We ate our cold KFC and waited for the engineer, who fixed the door lock but then the electricity didn't work. We waited for the second engineer. Eventually we had power and were able to get into our room but it was too late to go out by then anyway. Our second room, on the return journey was on the 7th floor and was a twin smoking room, they said it was all they had. As soon as the lift doors opened the stink hit us, it was absolutely vile. If I had known how bad it was going to be I would never have accepted the room. The room itself was old and not at all like the first one, badly in need of refurbishment and fumigating. We were called in the morning again by the rep just before 9am. We decided to give the breakfast a miss. On checkout, reception staff weren't too bad. The airport transfer coach was about 30 mins late. All in all, we would not stay at the Allson again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: JayneAustralia
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to Raffles hotel, shops, Bugis market is within walking distance. The hotel itself was clean, breakfast nice and fresh, staff very helpful and room was just the right size. overall a very nice place to stay and location was great. We could walk to many things and taxi's were always there outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: uskuhlmans
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because I was attending a conference at the Raffles City Convention Center and did not care to pay the Swissotel prices. The location was perfect, given my needs, and the overall experience was fine. The price was good and I felt that I received adequate value but the property just seemed a bit dated and tired. It appeared to be a tour hotel for Aussies--which was no problem. It did not have much soul and felt like I was constantly being processed. Staff were friendly and helpful but again with a practiced feel. The breakfast was good but unimaginative. While I have no real complaint, the place never really clicked, though I would have no problem recommending it as a decent place to stay at modest cost.

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers?”
Reviews.Author: PanDNewZealand
Reviews.Content: Not entirely sure how we ended up at Allson. Magazine travel article recommendation, I think. Usually pick our hotels by carefully reading web site traveler reviews. Must remember not to deviate next time. Allson appears to be Asian copy of Fawlty Towers. Booked and paid for non-smoking double months ahead. Allocated smoking twin, "not too smokey" (!!). Nothing else available until next day. Ordered morning paper. Room very dated, bathroom tired, beds extremely hard. No morning paper, complain. Move to double, non-smoking room. Door lock/power master switch card faulty. Room very dated, bathroom tired, bed extremely hard, Most electrics via bedside console … turn bedside lamp on, entry light turns off (and vice versa), adjust air cond' temp' and 'do not disturb' (electric sign outside door) cycles on and off with each degree adjustment, select 'do not disturb' and air' cond' temp' changes. Water line noise from our room and adjacent rooms very noisy, ditto drain noise. Bath 're-coated', grubby (in re-coating). No morning paper, complain. No bath towels, no bath mat, delivered promptly. Next day, finally get morning paper. No bath mat, delivered promptly. Next day, use hotel laundry, locked out of laundry halfway through wash/dry due heavy rain (outside access to laundry). Waste half an hour getting reception to get security to unlock access door. No toilet paper, delivered promptly. Final day, 1500 checkout, lift/door card incorrectly programmed, locked out of lift and room, waste more time getting new card. Subsequent 'proper' review of Trip Advisor shows most of above previously reported (silly us!). On positive note, price not too bad, breakfast good (didn't try other meals) but suggest don't buy 'room rate with breakfast' as food appeared to be being offered to guests on casual basis at well below 'with room' rate. Staff generally friendly except reception 'mechanical'. Location fairly good.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Nice”
Reviews.Author: Bristraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a Singapore Airlines stopover on the way to Europe and was happy with the hotel. When we arrived early in the morning we had to wait for a few hours until checkin, but were still allowed to checkin around 9am which was quite a few hours before their official time. Room aircon was quite cold and the room was quite reasonably sized and clean. Was close to all attractions, and there was a 7-11 just next door for some cheap drinks other than the mini bar. Didn't eat in any of the restaurants as other alternatives close by. Overall quite a good hotel for the money, certainly not luxurious but either was the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Jen1985
Reviews.Content: I am a Travel Agent in New Zealand and booked to stay here for 5 nights with my boyfriend. We arrived mid afternoon and were able to check in immediately. We had requested a non smoking room, on a high level with a double/queen size bed. We were given the 12th floor, non smoking but it had two single beds so we chose to move down to the 6th floor, which was a smoking room, but had a queen size bed. I HATE the smell of stale smoke, but this room smelt fresh & lovely and the only giveaway was the ash tray. Room was spacious with a desk, sitting area and tv. Bathroom and bedroom decor was very dated compared to the original 12th floor room, but considering we were out exploring every day it was clean, tidy and a central location. Travel Desk/Concierge were very helpful when it came to arranging tours and taxi's were always waiting right outside the entrance to the hotel. There was a small 7/11 Convenience Store next door where we stocked up on cold drinks and snacks and also a small restaurant... on the right hand side of the hotel was a fantastic 'hawker centre' (food court) which has yummy food at VERY reasonable prices (SGD$3 - $5). The Allson is in close walking distance to Raffles, Suntec City, Bugis Night Bazaar and many other malls. We used the MRT once but found the cost of taxi's were so cheap it was more convenient to taxi everywhere. All in all, a good hotel in a good location and would stay here again :)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: chirpybird
Reviews.Content: We had a comfortable 2 nights' stay at the Allson. The room is a little dated, bed rather hard but everything worked and it was comfortable and good value for money. Allson's location is central to the MRT, shopping, food courts and Raffles.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Coghlan
Reviews.Content: Coghlan's from Australia.............October 2008 We have stayed in Singapore dozens of times over the years but this was our first stay at the Allson and we stayed 3 days after a cruise. Our travel agent chose the Allson this time as we like the area and have stayed at other local hotels. The room was on the 11th floor and was OK and a good size however we could hear running water everytime nearby rooms used the shower or toilet etc. The bed was rock hard and due to thin single window glass we could hear traffic from the front and back of the hotel. The saviour for this hotel is its location but I think we will be moving back to other hotels in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient, Decoration Dated”
Reviews.Author: chanmsf
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for three nites. 'We' include a couple, a 1 year old bb and our domestic helper. The room is clean. No bed bugs. Very quite. Convenient location. 5 minutes' walk to two MRT station and commerical area. Food courts locate next to hotel and across the road. Decoration of the room and lobby is old fashioned and dated. We supposed to have booked a triple room and requested for a king size bed. It turned out to be a twin room with an added folding bed placing in between which has a overly soft mattress and made the room crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Clean”
Reviews.Author: jamitch
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a two night stopover on our way to Europe in May and on our way back in July 2008. We were happy with our room, clean and comfortable especially the beds . The Concierge was always helpful and friendly. The air con worked well and was appreciated. Full buffet breakfast was quite good. The hotel has a pool which we didn't use. This hotel is in a very convenient location. The food court next door is good and very cheap, we ate there twice. Close to shopping malls in fact we walked everywhere from the Hotel. I'd stay there again .

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: AussieCloggi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well situated to shopping and the Markets. Walking distance to Little India and other attractions such as Canning Park. Very clean hotel with a pool which was great after a day of walking around in the humidity. The hotel is also close to restaurants and next to a food hall (if you are game to try the dishes!!) and don't want to eat at the hotel restaurant There were a couple of gift shops in the complex and it was 5 mins walk from the markets in Bugis St. Breakfast was good and service at the hotel was excellent. There is a shuttle bus to take you to and from the airport. We would recommend this hotel and stay there again. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stop-over”
Reviews.Author: SydSun
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean, roomy and comfortable. Excellent buffet for breakfast & dinner and a la carte lunch available, all at very reasonable prices and much-needed air-conditioned comfort! 7Eleven store right next door sold bottled water at half the price in the hotel itself (a 'must' in the humidity ). Had very cheap umbrellas for the afternoon rains as well ! The only disappointment after a long flight was the fact that only two teabags were supplied- any more was charged at $1 per bag!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly stopover hotel”
Reviews.Author: thomasinaLlanelli
Reviews.Content: The Allson was a clean comfortable hotel with very friendly staff. The room was spacious but (one little quibble) there was no milk in the fridge either on our outward or homeward stay. We had breakfast each morning which was VERY cheap if you were a guest. The hotel (the second oldest after Raffles we were told by the concierge) is a really short walk to Raffles and Raffles Shopping Mall. Chimes is a shorter walk still. Because of jet lag our time was limited but we can thoroughly recommend Allson. Also, the hotel shuffle made our transfer to and from so much easier - a boon when you come off a long flight.

Reviews.Title: “Good stopover hotel”
Reviews.Author: istana
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Allson in July with our 11 year old son. We had booked the Allson through the SIA stopover holiday program. It is a tourist hotel, but very good value for money. The hotel is well located, within walking distance of Raffles City MRT. Our room with the extra bed was all made and we didn't have to ask for extra towels for our son as is often the case. Our room was newly renovated, spotlessly clean and smelled good (not the musty smell you often get in city hotels in the tropics). We didn't have breakfast included, but they offered a 50% discount for hotel guests and the waitress pointed out that our son could get buffet breakfast for the same price. The staff was very friendly. There is a small gym and a pool with lounge chairs. They also have a launderette which comes in handy after a long holiday. I would definitely stay at the Allson again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy with Allson Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Helen72008
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Allson Hotel for four nights as part of a Singapore Airlines Stopover holiday, after researching reviews for many hotels on trip advisor. We were not disappointed. Most of the rooms have been renovated fairly recently and furniture and fittings were quite new and good quality. Our room and ensuite (nonsmoking on 12th floor) were spacious, clean and comfortable; no intruding noise from outside at night. There was a safe in room. Hotel's location, near Raffles Hotel, was excellent, with cheap eating close by; especially liked nearby Bugis Street market for food/shopping. We mainly made use of Singapore Stopover Hop On/Hop Off bus (free to Stopover customers, and a small charge for others) which we caught outside Raffles Hotel. Five minute walk to either Bugis MRT or City Hall MRT. (Mass Rapid Transport). 1.00 pm checkout from hotel. Staff willing to mind baggage behind front desk as we had 9.00 pm flight, and very much appreciated being able to access showers in pool area after checkout time before our flight. Concierage and his staff, in particular, were very pleasant and helpful. As part of the Singapore Stopover Holiday, we thought it good value for money and would stay there again. Helen & Peter, Kyneton, Victoria

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Pak
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four days. We found it very comfortable. The room and the washroom are decent size. The hotel is on a very central location. There are lots of restaurants, grocery stores and malls around the hotel. We actually stocked milk and snacks from this store called Cold storage locatred in the Bugis junction mall. Bugis street, Arab street, Boat quay, etc are all on a walking distnce. Bugis MRT station is two minutes walk. The only bad thing about the hotel is that if you have lots of luggage, you will have to carry it 4-5 stares from the hotel enterance to the elevator, where it can be loaded on the trolley, but the porter can help you with that. Also, the hotel reception is located on the second floor, not at the entrance. But these are minot things. Overall the hotel is good in its range.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Angel57
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights at at the start of my holiday and another 2 nights at the end. It was part of a Singapore Stopover deal offered by Singapore airlines. Found the hotel to be ideal as a base to explore Singapore, it's probably not as fancy as some but as we spent so little time there it really didn't matter. Our room was a good size, clean and comfy. We had breakfast in the hotel our first morning as we got a 50% discount but the selection wasn't very good, so we didn't eat there again. The hotel is just round the corner from Raffles who do a great breakfast deal of fruit juice, choice of pastry and tea or coffee for S$7 in their cafe. Another alternative is the Dome cafe which is just down the road from the hotel. If you like walking you can easily walk to Clarke Quay and Orchard Road from the hotel. The staff were very friendly especially Mervyn the chief concierge who helped organise our duck tour which was part of the Singapore stopover package and even arranged for us to be picked up. One of the tour desk guys was a bit pushy and tried to sell us tours, but we did our own thing.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stopover”
Reviews.Author: Phil404nz
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night as part of Singapore Ailines package. Centrally located and very friendly staff ready to assist. Facilities were as expected but the bed a little too firm for our liking. Shops, tours and transport readily available and inexpensive. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Member From Shellharbour Australia
Reviews.Content: This is the third time over the past 10 years we have stayed here, and although not particularly fancy, I think it is pretty reasonable for the money compared to most hotels, hence the above average rating because of value for money. That aside it is probably a middle of the road property. Pretty good location, and have never had any problems with the staff, cleanliness of rooms etc. Only continuing problem is the strip of marble on the floor separating the main room with the bathroom. It is quite high and is a real killer on the toes if you are not careful ! If we go back to Singapore we will stay here again as long as the Singapore Stopover continues to be a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for money, helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneTraveller55
Reviews.Content: I stayed twice at the Allson, with a trip to Malaysia in between, and would happily stay there again. As some others have said, the place is a bit tired but I found it spotlessly clean and all of the staff I dealt with were courteous and helpful. All staff – desk, concierge, housekeepers - always greeted us with a smile and a hello. I left a garment in my room when checking out which was found and returned by the housekeeping staff. A great bonus on our last day was the reception desk offering the option of keys to access the pool and showers (towels supplied) as we had a late flight out that night. The rooms and bathrooms are fairly small but they do not feel cramped (and we had an extra bed in the room for my 14yo son). I have stayed in smaller rooms in Europe and elsewhere! On both occasions I stayed in upper floor rooms – 11th and 13th floors – both of which floors are non-smoking and I found no problem with musty smells as some other reviewers have mentioned. If you are a non smoker I recommend explicitly asking for a non-smoking room when booking. The location, in the Historic District, is excellent. Bugis St, Little India, the River, Fort Canning are all within easy walking distance. The hotel is mid way between MRT Stations (Bugis or City Hall) for longer trips or there is a bus stop outside the front door. We faced onto Victoria St but heard no traffic noise at all. Breakfast is OK – choice of Chinese, Indian, Japanese, & English dishes (eggs cooked to order). There is a 24 hour hawker centre right next to the hotel which serves a variety of good cheap food and which has a bar. Overall, a great location, good value for money, helpful and friendly staff. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very backward front desk”
Reviews.Author: artgems
Reviews.Content: Clogged wash basin, grimy bathroom - all forgiveable. i've stayed in a bunch of hotels around the world and easily, this place has the worst ever front desk staff. house-keeping staff were polite. the staff here have never been trained on manners apparently. please go to class, people. Will never stay again or recommend and actually cut our stay short and moved to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Ever Location and Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Ken_Robyn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Allson as part of Singapore Airline's Singapore Stopover package when we travelled on our honeymoon in February/March 2008. We stayed twice, as we had a stopover in both directions. First visit was for 2 nights, the second was for 3 nights, so 5 nights all up. We were very happy with our choice and mentioned to each other a number of times that we'd stay there again if we were transiting through Singapore. The hotel is extremely well located, with train stations and major shopping districts only a few minutes walk away. We did nearly all of our Singapore sightseeing on foot from the hotel, where you can easily walk to Raffles, the Marina, the Esplanade, Suntec City, and heaps and heaps of shopping centres. Bugis Village and Bugis Junction take less than 5 minutes to walk to. Plus there is an awesome hawker centre next door (Victoria Street Food Centre), which is lively and has heaps of cheap and very delicious foods on offer! The hotel may be a little tired, but it was immaculately clean and very comfortable. Beds and pillows were comfortable, and you have the option of requesting privacy in your room if you're just too tired to go out and you don't want housekeeping to disturb you. Floor 11 is non-smoking which was perfect for us. And despite its city location, you don't hear any street noise and the blockout curtians meant we were easily able to nap during the day after arriving on a redeye flight. Reception were fairly friendly, though when we checked in early after that redeye flight, were were told we could check in from 9am and when we went to the desk, we were told the rooms were not yet ready, but they'd let us know. They didn't - I kept an eye on things myself. That was the only negative bit. Concierge and the doormen were friendly and polite, helped with bags and were happy to give directions to the sights and shops. Restaraunt staff were great. We had breakfast in the restaurant just to save time looking elsewhere and got a 50% reduction because we were hotel guests, and the western and local options easily kept us going until lunchtime. As an aside, the Singapore Stopover holiday is brilliant - free transfers to and from the airport, major discount at the hotel (we payed less than $100 per day), and lots of free tickets to local attractions. A few reviews on here complained about musty smells, small bathrooms and inattentive staff, but I've had worse at 5 star hotels in Australia. It was clean, comfy, well located and everyone was polite - who cares if the bathroom isn't massive? Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: ezza_83
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a SIngapore Airlines stopover package - a very very cheap way to see the city. The hotel was fine - the rooms smelt a little bit musty, but were comfortable enough. The concierge staff were excellent - they had great directions for us and even booked us a very reasonable mini van out to the night zoo. This was the absolute highlight of the trip, as our van driver arranged tickets for us in advance and we received VIP service all night. A definite must!

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: myoc2001
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 and stayed for 3 nights. Hotel is well located, not too far from an MRT station and within walking distance of Bugis St Markets and Sim Lim Square. Rooms clean and nicely appointed, but no view to speak of. Hotel staff were generally helpful. Concierge was able to arrange reasonably priced transport for us to visit attractions. Breakfast was enjoyable with varied choices of asian and western food. We had trouble with the room configuration......we had booked two rooms expecting a double room for us and a twin room with extra bed for our three children, instead we were given two twin rooms with an extra bed! When we asked for a double room we were told that the hotel was fully booked. I have experienced this in many asian hotels, they don't seem to be willing to re-allocate rooms if they make a mistake - it's just easier for them to say 'we're fully booked'. Other than that, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “different standard between floors”
Reviews.Author: js4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December and it was pretty much as expected based on most of the reviews from this website. We had requested 2 interconnecting rooms but were first given rooms some distance apart on the fifth floor. When we commented on this they changed one of the rooms so that they were adjacent and the following afternoon reception staff phoned the room and offered us interconnecting rooms on the 14th floor. Although the layout was similar the rooms on the 5th floor lacked several items supplied upstairs. The upper floor had a 'real' queensize bed not twins merely placed side by side. We now had a clock and bedside controls for lighting etc, enough seating, additional items of toiletries and a privacy button that could be activated to keep away well meaning staff restocking tea and coffee too early in the morning! There didn't appear to be any difference in the price of these rooms but the upper level was certainly much more comfortable; it was also non-smoking which was a vast improvement. As noted by previous reviewers the location is so convenient. We didn't need to catch the MRT. Most times we would just walk in any direction and find a shopping centre within 5 minutes or so. It was also an easy walk back from Orchard Rd after catching a taxi there for next to nothing.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for the budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: ohtobea_globetrotter
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a wonderful 6 day stay in Singapore. I must say that this site was instrumental in helping us arrive at a decision in the choice of hotel. The Allson, most centrally located as it is, was real value for money. Our room, a double with an extra bed, was clean and very comfortable. The hotel staff, as well as those manning the tour desk, were polite and friendly. Breakfast (included in our price) was a sumptuous buffet with a large continental and oriental spread. A real boon was the 7/11 store next door. An adjoining foodcourt serves local and Indian meals; several food choices exist within walking distance. We enjoyed walking in Singapore.. the hotel's location is conducive to all means of transport. I wouldn't hesitate recommending the Allson to anyone.. of course those keen on luxury should probably look elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & well priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: vlandgw
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Allson and found it to be very well located to the MRT, bus stop and food outlets. The hawker centre right next door is open 24 hours a day and a 7/11 is also close by not to mention plenty of options within a 5 to 10 minute walk.. We found the reception staff very helpful especially as we arrived at 9:30pm to find that our reservation had not been made by the booking website we used although we had paid in full. The hotel was very accommodating and provided a room and breakfast as booked for our three nights. While we had to pay the hotel directly for this they provided a discounted rate for same. They were extremely helpful in a stressful situation. The rooms are clean and comfortable and provided all we required for our stay. We would stay at The Allson again when in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “No Breakfast !!”
Reviews.Author: Yatragirl
Reviews.Content: Good location, clean hotel but nothing else really. Breakfast was included in the room charge on the website, but we were told we couldn't have any, after a long flight to Singapore ! The hotel staff needed repeated reminders to clean the room, and we saw people checking out hours after we were told that the checkout time was noon !!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: KiwiMum11
Reviews.Content: We had a two night stop over courtesy of Singapore Airlines at the Allson Hotel. Our room was comfortable and the standard of servicing was excellent. The room was clean and we were very impressed that we were able to go straight to our room when we arrived before 9 am. The porters in the lobby were friendly and helpful and even waved to us after taking our luggage to the bus which was to take us to the airport. We had only one unfortunate incident and that was in the hotel restaurant when we had breakfast. We didn't realise that a waiter would serve you and it wasn't made clear to us at the desk. It was an embarrassment to serve myself a small bowl of fruit salad with the quantity that I preferred only to arrive back with my cup of tea to find that the waiter had removed my bowl and replaced it with a much larger bowl, which I couldn't really cope with and most of the fruit was wasted. Perhaps it needs to be different to European Hotels but it was very embarrassing and I wanted to leave as soon as possible having quite lost what appetite I had.

Reviews.Title: “Allson - just OK!”
Reviews.Author: limelemon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of the Singapore Stopover package during the last leg of our trip. Our experience at this hotel was OK. Here are some observations. 1. The location was excellent - conveniently located between 2 MRT stations Bugis and City Hall. It is approx. a 5 minute walk to either stations from the hotel. 2. If you chose not to eat at the hotel, there is a small hawker centre located just beside the hotel and another right across from the hotel. There are also restaurants and a food court at Bugis Junction. There is also a 7-Eleven right beside the hotel for quick snacks, drinks etc. 3. We were given a room with a "queen sized" bed beside an elevator. Unfortunately, we were not comfortable due to a noisy elevator and an uncomfortable bed. We asked to be transferred to another room. The receptionist, without smiling, promptly informed us that this couldn't be done tonight because there were no more rooms and that we had to come back tomorrow. We returned the following day with the request. It was done but quite mechanically-no warm friendly smile. We were just glad we were transferred to another room with twin beds and away from the elevator! Thankfully, we didn't have to deal with reception again till we checked out. 4. An annoyance was that the key card reader was not working properly in the elevator. This resulted in having to insert the key card again..and again..hoping that it works. 5. The room was very basic-no iron, no ironing board, no robes, no slippers. At least there was a safe! There was a note posted by the coffee/tea/mugs/kettle that indicates that if you wanted to request more coffee/tea, that you will be charged $1.00 for additional packets. Thought that was quite odd. The rosewood furniture was lovely and added a nice touch to the room. The bathroom was tiny but at least it was clean. 6. Housekeeping staff were friendly and ensured that the rooms and bathroom were kept clean. They also ensured that the amenities were stocked. 7. There is not much a pool and a gym at this hotel. We didn't bother using these facilities anyway. So, if you are looking to swim laps or get in a work-out or two, you will be disappointed. There are no free weights in the gym. A good point is that there is a self-serve laundry facility on site. 8. Staffwise-other than Housekeeping, the only other person that seemed to be friendly and cheerful was the person operating the tour desk. All in all, an OK hotel to stay at. Functional and basic but don't expect any frills.

Reviews.Title: “Second tier hotel, but worth considering”
Reviews.Author: NKC
Reviews.Content: The Allson is a small, unpretentious hotel that caters primarily to package tours Its convenient location and reasonable price make it worth considering when one is looking for basic accommodations. The strong points of the hotel are: 1. The hotel is conveniently located on a main thoroughfare, within walking distance of many of the center-city attractions of Singapore. It is a 10-minute walk to the Suntec Convention Centre, where I was attending a conference. 2. With the exception of a few problems at Reception, described below, services such as housekeeping and laundry were very friendly and reliable. 3. Guests rooms are very clean but noticeably worn in places: e.g., chipped, scratched furniture, cracked light switch. 4. Internet access - The hotel has good wired internet access in the rooms, although it can be noticeably slower during peak access times. At approximately US$ 13.70 per day, it is a little pricey on the worldwide scale, but not outrageous. The access port is controlled by the Front Desk and service can be purchased for the entire stay. This eliminates the need for passwords and avoids the too-hasty time-outs that one often encounters in hotel internet services. 5. The hotel has a swimming pool and workout facilities. 6. As one would expect in a Singapore hotel, staff appear to be genuinely friendly. There are several weak points that would make me think twice about returning to this hotel if comparable or better accommodations were available elsewhere: 1. Front Desk / Reception should be the strongest part of a hotel experience. At the Allson it is the weakest. I had annoying problems both at check-in and check-out. a. I was not given the type of room that I had booked, due in part to the lack of information that expedia.com had provided to the hotel; however, I was moved the next morning. b. The hotel's card reader was not working properly, which resulted my having to trudge about the streets of Singapore, at 2:00 a.m. after a 30-hour airplane journey, in search of an ATM, so that I could pay a cash deposit (obtained with the same card that would not work at the hotel) and check in. c. Upon departure, I requested a copy of my bill in advance, but the Reception clerk refused to present one until check-out. There is no video review of one's account or video checkout. d. Although it did not affect my departure, Reception appears to be understaffed during peak periods, as evidenced by significant lines between 1000 and the hotel's 1100 checkout time. e. Otherwise, Reception staff were professional and responsive. 2. Restaurant - Like most hotel buffets, the Allson's is best avoided except in a last resort. The breakfast buffet is of average quality and variety, but not nearly worth the US$ 24 price. The 50% discount for hotel guests, before tax and service charge, helps to bring the price more in line with the value delivered. I noticed that people staying on a package tour received breakfast included. The better alternative, if one has time, is to try the many cafes, coffee shops, and 24-hour eateries all within one block of the hotel. 3. Guest rooms - My "executive room" was very clean but also very sparse in terms of amenities: very old hair dryer, no iron or ironing board, small work table, only one arm chair. The room did have a mini-bar / refrigerator that was lightly stocked. The room was of adequate size, but not spacious. 4. Bellman / porter / concierge services are understaffed and usually non-existent. Bottom line: The Allson is definitely second tier among Singapore hotels -- maybe even third -- and noticeably below the quality and features of the larger, better-known hotels nearby. It is also noticeably below them in price. The Allson offers a credible alternative that can be quite satisfactory for someone looking for clean basic accommodation in the US$ 100 to US$ 150 range.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad!”
Reviews.Author: TerryEmu
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night plus a 9 hour late checkout for which we paid nearly the same price as the one nights stay , this is par for the course in Singapore. There is a good food hall opposite the Hotel with a large selection food types. With the money you save eating here you could have glass of red cordial called a Singapore Sling in the Raffles for S$23.80.

Reviews.Title: “swipe cards”
Reviews.Author: Janitta
Reviews.Content: The Allson staff were very friendly and helpful but found the swipe card for the lift and bedrooms if you were above 4th floor rather a pain. Sometimes it worked other times it didnt.. Otherwise would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: clmbsb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on our way to Melbourne and 1 night on our return from Sydney. Check in was a nightmare on arrival as we had to wait 4 hours for our room, not something you want after a 13 hour flight, check in staff seemed unbothered about this. The room itself was big with a comfortable bed. Others have mentioned the bathroom and again our bath was shallow with some stains in it. The shower was not very powerful but i find that everywhere i go except for B&B's. Breakfast was ok and enough to set us up till lunchtime. The location was good, within a easy walk of everything or near the bus stop. A word of warning, if you book a taxi back to the airport with the hotel so no beleive them when they tell you the price. On the way to the airport for our flight to Melbourne we were told $18 the first thing the taxi driver asked us when we got in was "do you know the price"? We said $18 and he looked at us like we were joking and said no it's around $30. Nothing more was said as i had a face like thunder and looked away. Again on our way to the airport for our flight home we was told no more than $23 (it was rush hour) but it was $26 when we got there. Overall i would stay again if we returned to Singapore (very much doubt it) but only if we did a one night stopover and arrived after midday so we don't have to wait for a room.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing! It's only a 2-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Takami
Reviews.Content: The website where I booked this hotel from says it's a 4-star hotel, but in fact it's only a 2-star. The hotel itself looks old and the room too, especially the bathroom. The bath-tub got stains in it. The hairdryer is the worst as it blew out air with bad smell of second-hand smoke. Can you believe that? About the service, I really dont think the front desk people are working with their heart. The first night I reached the hotel with a heavy hand carry bag, I got to the room and found out the key didnt work. I went down again and this lady processed my keycard with a machine and handed it back to me without an apology. Obviously she forgot to do so when I checked-in. Overall, this hotel is like a budget hotel and certainly doesnt worth the money (approx. USD100 per nite).

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: stingray_barb
Reviews.Content: I was booked in to this hotel through the Singapore Airlines Stopover deal, and was expecting to be given a small and poky room. Instead I got a big room that was clean and comfortable, with a big bathroom that included a bath. The airconditioning was extremely effective, the staff very friendly and the location very convenient. Taxi fares were about $5 to Tangs or Takashimaya department stores. Its a short enough distance to walk but was too hot for me!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: BEEPfromPARIS
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 nights in this hotel on the SINGAPORE AIRLINES stopover program. At 54 euros a night, it was a fair deal. As included Minibus transfer stopped at several other hotels before ours, it took some time to reach the ALLSON. So we opted for the MRT back to the airport a few days later, twice as fast and at a mere 1,80 SGD (0,95 EUR). Very well situated on Victoria st, midway between BUGIS and CITY HALL stations. Almost every place was within walking distance. To our european standard, it was a good 3 stars. With as usual singaporean efficiency. Room was comfortable, well appointed and clean. Nothing to love, or to dislike ; a very well situated hotel at reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel”
Reviews.Author: punchhard
Reviews.Content: Easy access to MRT, local food & fruit. Small room but it had everything that met my requirement - CLEAN. Very nice housekeeper, friendly receptionist & concierge. I will stay at this hotel on my next visit to Singapore. Forgot to mention - if you have a late flight, this hotel will allow you take a shower before you go to the airport eventhough you already checkout. Hotel was booked through asiabesthotel.com

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, small rooms, great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: kfraser82
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Allson Hotel in Singapore for 4 days at the end of our 10 day honeymoon. We had just come from 6 days in Kuala Lumpur - two completely different cities! The Allson is a very well appointed hotel, slightly older decor, but well maintained. Lots of dark wooden panelling and features which looks quite nice against the crisp white sheets and the red carpet. The room we had was quite small and we only had a view of the street behind the hotel. The pool area looked quite lovely, however not convenient to get to (down to the 3rd or 4th floor, down the corridor past the other rooms, out the door, down some steep spiral stairs and then to the pool). We spent most of our time outside walking around town to be bothered by the confinement of the rooms. The service was friendly expecially from the gents at the Concierge desk. Manu was a very friendly man who offered some wonderful local knowledge. We dined at Equinox on the 71st floor of the Swissotel at his recommendation. An amazing view (not revolving), delicious food, however very expensive. We had a full 3 course meal with wine and coffee and it was $530SGD. I would recommend that you visit Singapore Zoo - like no other zoo I've seen. No fences, just deep trenches filled with water separate you and the animals. Just gorgeous. The Night Safari was good, but so dark you can't see much. Still, an exciting experience to be that close to such amazing animals. We did High Tea at Raffles which was stunning! However, do not eat a big breakfast/lunch or plan a large dinner - there is so much food and so much more than just cucumber sandwiches and scones. The food was spectacular and it just kept coming. We were there for 3 hours and were stuffed full. We also had Singapore Slings/G&T's at the Long Bar of Raffles. A wonderful experience to just sit back and sip on a drink, eat some peanuts and discuss the day. Take a walk through the entire Civic District (Raffles and the Allson are in it) as it has beautiful old world charm. To get around town I advise you use the clean and efficient service provided by the train system. On time, cheap and regular services ensure you can get where you want with the least amount of fuss. Boat Quay is a must with a fantastic variety of restaurants. Don't stop at the first one you find, some of the better ones are in towards the middle. Also try to do a boat ride on the river at night. Suntec City is pretty amazing to walk around as is Chinatown. Go to Chinatown in the late afternoon to get its full benefit. Orchard Rd is great if you want to shop - very westernised shopping district with all the big brand names you would expect in Sydney/Melbourne/London/LA etc. Not really what I came to Singapore for, although we did get 2 suits made for my husband from Christian Armani which is in Scott's Mall off Orchard Road. Very well made and excellent service - about 1/2 the price we would have paid in Australia. Overall, we had a magnificent time in Singapore, not long enough though. The Allson Hotel provided us with a good, clean hotel which was very accommodating and so close to everything it made the whole trip worthwhile. I would highly recommend this hotel for those who don't mind a smaller room and who will be spending a lot of time out sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: clandite
Reviews.Content: stayed here for one week no complaints,nice and central nearest mrt station five minutes walk lot's of food outlets nearby,nice comfortable room and good hot working shower,special mention for the concierge had an evening flight and they stored luggage no hastle and pre ordered a taxi to take me to the airport which arrived bang on time.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: briztraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Allson for 2 nights with my family on the way to Australia. The rooms were clean and the beds big and comfortable (my 8-yr-old daughter could sleep comfortably with my wife). The bathroom was spotless and looked new. The buffet breakfast was very good, they even had Japanese food (miso, tofu etc). The reception staff as well as the concierge were very helpful. I left a bag in a taxi and the concierge managed to locate the taxi and get my bag back. The pool was nice and clean. There's a food court and a Seven-Eleven right next door. The hotel is in the city centre and within walking distance to Little India. The bus stop to Chinatown is opposite the hotel. Peter, Brisbane, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything”
Reviews.Author: Frank M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very ordinary except for the location. I had the intention of doing research at the National Library and the hotel is just opposite the library. The location is also unbeatable in terms of the subway, shopping and entertainment. It is walking distance to several subway stations, the Raffles City and Bugis shopping complexes and the Esplanade theatre and concert halls. There are also 7-11s and all-night eating places round the corner. However, the hotel itself is very old. Though refurbished several years ago with a name change, some areas like the bathroom look decades old. Furniture is of somewhat Chinese style - not appealing. Receptionists efficient but not warm or friendly.

Reviews.Title: “True Service”
Reviews.Author: PeterCan
Reviews.Content: Everything was just amazing. Great location, impressive building and features, magnificent staff and wonderful food. The Allson is so close to everything (loved the 7-11 right next door too - many midnight trips for an apple slurpee). We loved our stay there and wouldn't consider staying anywhere else on future visits. Special thanks to Mano on the Concierge Desk for making us feel very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not amazing”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghWanderer
Reviews.Content: We got the hotel as part of the Singapore airlines stopover on the way to NZ and probably cost us about £20pp per night B&B. It was clean had an excellent shower and clean laundry, towels and shampoos etc. There is a great pool outside but the advertised gym was rubbish, all the machines were old and broken. We arrived early and got checked in early. Apart from that I didn't find the staff particularly helpful or friendly. The breakfast was buffet style and was adequate without being spectacular. Overall it met our needs, central location clean etc, but if you are a yank and expect the best of everything, and everyone to (---) from the moment of arrival this isn't the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Sleeepy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aashil
Reviews.Content: Allson well its a very average hotel. Rooms are pathetically small..... Bathrooms are ok but still are not upto the mark. Staff is Kind and courteous but if are used to the Shereatons and Taj there is not point in staying here coz u ll cry thn. I went inside the hotel thinking it wud be sumwat good but its very average hotel. Wudnt stay here again thts for sure

Reviews.Title: “good, basic room in the heart of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: hashilla
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allson from Nov 9-12 2006 on the last leg of our SE Asia holiday. It was a basic comfortable room, clean and quiet. The breakfast buffet, although quite basic was all we needed in a city with more restaurants and hawker stalls than I had ever seen! Who needs breakfast when amazing food awaits!? The location was very central. We were able to walk to Arab Street, Raffles, Suntec City, and Little India. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for families and budget travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Why go anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: Fulfillingdreams
Reviews.Content: Took my sister and her two teenage children to Singapore for two weeks and by the time they left, they had terrific experiences and memories to take home. Apart from its location, the decor is more in keeping with the Orient(who wants to go to the Orient and stay in a hotel that feels like it could be anywhere in the world?), breakfasts suited even fussy teens, the service from the concierge, doormen, cleaning staff and chefs cooking eggs in front of you were outstanding. The friendliness and helpfulness were what make an impression. The doormen made every effort to make certain that everyone was happy and well taken care of.(we did observe that some guests treated them as if they did not exist - smiles and greetings and simple courtesies by guests don't cost much!) Some tourists can be so embarrassing. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone(I had stayed in the Allson previously and its quality was the same)

Reviews.Title: “could have been better”
Reviews.Author: me-and-u
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was Ok. The location was great., close to Bugis and the railway station. Two local food courts next door. What we didn't like was getting ripped off with the price. Singapore must be the only country in the world that quotes a figure then adds +++. We also asked for the quoted price to include breakfast. Found out when we checked in that the breakfast was extra. Also we asked for a room for 3 adults. We got a double room with a spare bed put inbetween the other two beds with no gaps inbetween. Result, extremely squashed up, only one person could walk in the room at a time. There was drilling etc work going on next door and it began at 6 in the morning. Very noisy. We went on our cruise and stayed at a different hotel on our return, same thing happened. +++ was added to out bill and no breakfast was quoted for although I had requested it. Apart from that very annoying trait of singapor hotels we were pleasantly surprised at the honesty of the taxi drivers. They were very helpful and didn't take us the long way around as they had done some years back when we last visited.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: simsu66
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally situated with Raffles, Orchard Road, Little India and Chinatown (if you are fit) all within walking distance. The hotel decor and rooms though are all a bit tired looking and worn out. Also only 2 tiny lifts for 14 floors and one of these invariably in use by the porters. With a bit of tlc this could be a great hotel. We only had 3 nights in Singapore so spent very little time in the hotel and as a base it served its purpose.
